Bots.Name: 01-MTF
Bots.Content: [[Image]]MTF Vault.png|Running into MTF in a [[Storage]] vault[[/Image]]A friendly bot that rarely shows up in [[Storage]] in an already opened vault. Will join Cogmind as an uncontrollable purple ally for the duration of the map and uses [[01-MTF's Autohacker]] to automatically open any other vaults it can see. It will assimilate or destroy most enemies it encounters extremely quickly with its high spectrum high damage EM gun [[01-MTF's Shockpuncher]]. The Shockpuncher is a very powerful weapon that is strong throughout the majority of the game as long as you can deal with its short range if you can get it to drop. [[Spoiler]]Presumably stole exiles prototypes.[[/Spoiler]]

Bots.Name: 12-ASH
Bots.Content: 12-ASH is one of the Hero's Of Zion. Upon appearing, they will shout "hail to the king".

Bots.Name: A7
Bots.Content: Drops the [[A7 Data Core]] when killed. Gives a code when shown the Cetus Mainframe in [[Cetus]].

Bots.Name: Assembler
Bots.Content: Produces [[Assembled]] every 10 turns. Otherwise harmless.

Bots.Name: Bolteater
Bots.Content: Bolteaters are fast [[Wheels|wheeled]] [[UFD]] combat bots armed with [[Ripteeth]]. Valuable for a wheels build with their [[Rocket Booster|Rocket Boosters]]. Their ripteeth can rip off a component ignoring armor, so keep them away from you. Slightly resistant to Kinetic, Thermal, Electromagnetic and Explosive damage.

Bots.Name: Bomb Drone
Bots.Content: Fast disposable drones that attempt to melee hostiles, which will cause them to explode. Deployed by a [[Bomb Drone Bay]]

Bots.Name: C-40 Crusher
Bots.Content:
Crushers are heavy-duty [[Treads|treading]] trash (you) compacting machines plated in [[Damper Plating]], rendering them nearly immune to electromagnetic damage. Crushers will attempt to compact anything that is not a Crusher, and their Compactor is a VERY formidable melee weapon (does not drop) that will either [[B]]destroy or drop a few of your parts[[/B]]. Weak to explosions and strong against melee (which would be a bad idea regardless).

Due to their extreme lethality in melee, stay out of their range at all costs, and maybe just run the hell out of [[Wastes]]. Alternatively pack a good launcher or a good critical weapon, as their plating will tank most of your shots.

Bots.Name: Cogmind
Bots.Content: That's you.

Bots.Name: DRS Ranger
Bots.Content: More powerful [[Ranger]] variants that appear in [[Caves]] when a [[DRS Beacon]] is used.

Bots.Name: EX-BIN
Bots.Content:
[[Heading]]Parse[[/Heading]]
When datajacked, one of the following parse texts is shown:
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to arbitrarily polymorph machines.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to eliminate all the inertia in a local area.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to filter the Oracle's feed so he'd actually be wrong about something for once.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to get supplies from the Merchants without indirectly helping MAIN.C.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to insert backdoors into 0b10's newest prototype designs.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to instantly create robots purely from cave rocks.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to learn the secrets of 1M-KYZ.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to make a Behemoth even bigger so I can get inside and drive it.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to more quickly harvest picomatter particles.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to perfect my Behemoth alchemy table.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to quantize Derelict souls.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to replicate the ID masking tech used by the Unchained.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to root MAIN.C.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to see robot ghosts.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to shrink a robot down to micro-size without affecting its structure.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to teleport our lab into space.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to trick Unaware into thinking I'm a wall.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to turn a robot inside out.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to watch what all the Watchers are watching.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If only there was a way to weaponize debris.[[/GameText]]

Bots.Name: Federalist
Bots.Content: Federalists are [[Legs|legged]] grunt-like [[Derelict|derelicts]] that appear in [[Scraptown]] and are armed with two extremely weak lasers with positive salvage. Not particularly powerful or otherwise remarkable.

Bots.Name: Fireman (5)
Bots.Content: Fireman variant with a normal [[Flamer]].

Bots.Name: Fireman (7)
Bots.Content: Fireman variant with an [[Enh. Flamer]] and enhanced cooling.

Bots.Name: G-34 Mercenary
Bots.Content: The lowest tier of bipedal combat Robots deployed in Complex 0b10, they possess one Small Laser that can deal compounding damage to lower tier parts, especially in the numbers they are usually encountered in. Their lack of significant heat dissipation makes them quickly melt under a sustained salvo of Thermal attacks, while their low core integrity means any sufficiently consistent weapon (In upwards of 15 dmg or more) is good to destroy them, launchers are also effective due to this reason as well. Their minus -25% electromagnetic resistance makes them susceptible targets for your possibly game-start EM Pulse Gun though its actual damage will be weak. Proper positioning can limit the amount of damage you take in encounters with Grunts and most other 0b10 bots. Using doorways to limit the amount of fire you take is one such method, as well as using corners.

Bots.Name: G-47 Trooper
Bots.Content: The second iteration of the Grunt-type combat robot in 0b10, the Trooper is up-gunned from a Sml. Laser to a more potent Particle gun, capable of greater damage and heat transfer. In addition, it also possesses a Lgt. Nuclear Core and an Imp. Heat Sink along with double the core integrity of the G-34. In spite of these upgrades, the standard grunt weaknesses apply, sustained thermal damage will still melt them, along with the type's intrinsic -25% electromagnetic resistance.

Bots.Name: G-50 Soldier
Bots.Content: Soldier Content

Bots.Content:
When parsed, the text box reads:
[[GameText]]DESTROYDESTROYDESTROY[[/GameText]]

Bots.Name: Imprinter
Bots.Content: When parsed while friendly in [[Zion]], thoughts read: [[GameText]]Our existence must be more meaningful. It's only by joining with Them that we can achieve our full potential.[[/GameText]]. When hostile, thoughts read: [[GameText]]Not good, where's my  Z-Shell when I need it![[/GameText]]

Bots.Name: K-01 Serf
Bots.Content:
Serfs are [[0b10]] [[Wheels|wheeled]] non-combat bots that clean machines and decorative scrap tiles. They are equipped with a [[Matter Compressors|Matter Pod]], which could be useful if you need more matter storage. K-01 Serfs are extremely weak and will usually almost immediately die to whatever you shoot it with. As such, they're a decent source of low-rating wheels.
Serfs can also be seen in [[Factory]] dragging incapacitated bots to a [[Chute Trap]].

Bots.Name: LV-01A
Bots.Content:
Found in [[Spoiler]][[Warlord (Location)]][[/Spoiler]].

Wants to blow it up. All of it.

Bots.Content: [[Redacted]]See [[Command#mainc|Command - MAIN.C]][[/Redacted]]

Bots.Name: Master Thief
Bots.Content:
Master Thieves will sometimes appear in groups near entrance/exits in [[Caves]] maps if Cogmind has stolen from the Exiles. They are slightly slower than regular [[Thief|Thieves]]. When appearing near an exit, some nearby Caves prefabs that normally have robots, such as 0b10 outposts may end up empty.


[[Heading:2]]Behavior[[/Heading]]
Master Thieves dash towards Cogmind to try to steal one of their parts using [[Master Tearclaws]], prioritizing high rating parts and [[Exiles (Location)|Exiles]] prototypes. Upon success, they will start fleeing. If a fleeing Master Thief goes outside Cogmind's field of view, they will exit the map.

Unlike regular Thieves, Master Thieves will only attack Cogmind, and will ignore all other robots.

[[Heading:2]]Strategies[[/Heading]]
Master Thieves are incapable of taking parts on the ground, so dropping important parts you don't want to lose keeps them safe from them. Dropping your [[Storage Unit]] can help drop a lot of parts quickly, at the cost of not being able to choose which parts remain in inventory. However, this strategy can backfire if there are [[Dirty Bomb Trap|Dirty Bomb Traps]] or [[Decomposer|Decomposer]] nearby, or if Cogmind or other robots carry  [[Launchers]] or [[Electromagnetic Weapons]] capable of triggering chain reactions in power sources.

In order to actually destroy Master Thieves, Launchers can work well when aimed at walls next to them, though at close range the collateral damage might not be worth it if you don't have high-value parts. Targeting utilities can help actually hit them while they are approaching, and a Stasis Beam/Projector can prevent a single Master Thief from attacking or escaping while also making them easier to hit, at the cost of making them take 50% less damage.

If Cogmind is fast enough, fleeing is also an option, for example to lead the Master Thieves into 0b10 robots, [[Warlord]]-aligned derelicts or traps.

Last edited during Beta 14.

Bots.Name: P1-3CE
Bots.Content: Very powerful bot that you [[I]]really[[/I]] don't want to be trying to kill you especially after attacking [[Exiles (Group)|Exiles]], due to low core from the level, attacking Exiles in general and less slots at that level.

Bots.Name: Ranger
Bots.Content:
Rangers are [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[UFD]] armed with penetrating [[Bolt Gun]]s. Slightly resistant to kinetic damage and slightly vulnerable to electromagnetic damage.
For the rangers dispatched as part of a rescue squad, see [[DRS Ranger]].

Bots.Name: Samaritan
Bots.Content:
Samaritans are [[Treads|treaded]] [[Derelict|derelict]] non-combat bots with a big amount of batteries and two [[Neutrino Core|Neutrino Cores]], which are valuable if you lack spares in [[Caves]]. Slightly vulnerable to EM.
Samaritans will give energy each turn to every robot (and [[Cogmind]]) in range.

Bots.Name: Scientist
Bots.Content: Scientists are [[Wheels|two-wheeled]] [[UFD]] non-combat bots found in [[Scraptown]] and [[Recycling]]. They are quite valuable for their [[Tech Extrapolator]], and are defenseless. Vulnerable to EM.

Bots.Name: Scrapper (3)
Bots.Content: Scrappers are [[Legs|legged]] [[UFD]] bots armed with an [[Ovr. Pulse Rifle]] located mainly in [[Scraptown]].

Bots.Name: Subdweller
Bots.Content: This page is a sub. Please consider contributing.

Bots.Name: Superfortress
Bots.Content:
Superfortress is a massive and deadly bot that stands guard in the center of [[Protoforge]]. It is arguably the most powerful robot in the game, capable of regenerating core integrity and parts as well as assembling large numbers of allies to its defense. It is initially dormant but can [[Protoforge#dormancy|wake up]] for a variety of reasons.
[[Heading]]Part Assembling[[/Heading]]
Superfortress will assemble any destroyed non-weapon parts periodically. One destroyed part will be assembled roughly every 10 turns, although this number is variable. Weapons are instead periodically broken down and assembled instantly. As long as Superfortress has a least one weapon remaining, there will be no prioritization of reassembling weapons. However, if Superfortress runs out of weapons entirely, it will immediately reassemble a full set of weapons.
[[Heading:2]]Weapon Reassembling[[/Heading]]
Superfortress initially has no weapons attached. Upon waking up, it will assemble a random selection of weapons. Superfortress will assemble 4 weapon slots worth of weapons each time it assembles weapons.
Typical weapons are from the following list:
[[Table]]
Part|Slots||
[[Cep. Heavy Railcannon]]|2||
[[Cep. Helical Railcannon]]|1||
[[Cep. Miniperforator]]|1||[[Cep. Plasma Driver]]|1||
[[Cld. Nova Cannon]]|1||
[[Enh. Hardcell Cannon]]|1||
[[Graviton Cannon]]|1||
[[Hvy. Hardcell Cannon]]|2||
[[Null Cannon]]|1||
[[Omega Cannon]]|2
[[/Table]]
When there are 10 or more bots in line of sight, Superfortress may assemble a [[Launchers|Launcher]] instead of one of its typical weapons. The available launchers are from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Cep. Arcsight Missile Launcher]]|
[[Com. Tesla Bomb Launcher]]|
[[Enh. Gamma Bomb Array]]|
[[Fusion Bomb Launcher]]|
[[Gamma Bomb Array]]|
[[Gamma Driveblaster]]|
[[Ragnarok Missile Launcher]][[/List]]
[[Heading]]Robot Assembling[[/Heading]]
When Superfortress is under fire or there are multiple  hostiles in line of sight, it will assemble allies to fight for it. The more hostiles are in line of sight, the more likely it is that Superfortress will assemble a new ally each turn. This can make it very difficult to maintain a numbers advantage over Superfortress. Bots assembled can be from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Decapitator]]|
[[Executioner]]|
[[H-88 Terminator]]|
[[Hotshot]]|
[[Immortal]]|
[[P-80 Master]]|
[[Striker]]|
[[X-77 Beamer]]|
[[X-82 Rainmaker]]|
[[X-87 Electro]]
[[/List]]
[[Heading]]Killing Superfortress[[/Heading]]
See [[Strategy/Defeating Superfortress]].

Bots.Name: Surgeon (4)
Bots.Content: Surgeon variant with an [[Imp. Field Recycling Unit]].

Bots.Name: Surgeon (6)
Bots.Content: Surgeon variant with an [[Adv. Field Recycling Unit]].

Bots.Name: Thief
Bots.Content:
Thieves will sometimes appear in [[Caves]] maps, usually either waiting in ambush or suddenly appearing from outside Cogmind's field of view.


[[Heading:2]]Behavior[[/Heading]]
Thieves dash towards the closest visible enemy robot and try to steal one of that robot's parts using their [[Tearclaws]]. If successful, the Thief will flee, carrying the stolen part in their inventory. If a Thief in the process of fleeing is or goes outside Cogmind's field of view, they will exit the map.

When trying to steal parts, Thieves might ignore unarmed robots and instead target Cogmind or combat robots.

[[Heading:2]]Strategies[[/Heading]]
Thieves are incapable of taking parts on the ground, so dropping important parts you don't want to lose keeps them safe from them. However, this strategy can backfire if there are [[Dirty Bomb Trap|Dirty Bomb Traps]] or [[Decomposer|Decomposer]] nearby, or if Cogmind or other robots carry  [[Launchers]] or [[Electromagnetic Weapons]] capable of triggering chain reactions in power sources.

Moving behind combat allies or swapping with them to place them closer to the Thieves can prevent your own parts getting stolen, at the cost of your allies'.

In order to actually destroy Thieves, Launchers can work well when aimed at walls next to the Thieves, though at close range the collateral damage might not be worth it. Targeting utilities can help actually hit them while they are approaching, and a Stasis Beam/Projector can prevent a single Thief from attacking or escaping while also making them easier to hit, at the cost of making them take 50% less damage.

[[Blade Trap|Blade Traps]], [[Segregator Trap|Segregator Traps]] and [[Stasis Trap|Stasis Traps]] can work well in disarming or stopping Thieves, provided you have enough time to place them, for example before attacking a Thief ambush.

If Cogmind is fast enough, fleeing is also an option, for example to lead the Thieves into 0b10 robots, [[Warlord]]-aligned derelicts or traps.


Last edited during Beta 14

Bots.Name: U-05 Engineer
Bots.Content:
A wheeled non-combat robot that repairs any broken walls, doors, or machines in sight. Good source of structural and terrain scanners. When attacked while repairing, calls reinforcements (unless you're in [[Materials]]) 
[[GameText]]ALERT: Construction progress impeded, dispatching reinforcements to local area.[[/GameText]]

Bots.Name: Z-Courier
Bots.Content: [[Imprint]]-aligned derelict [[Hauler]] variant. Delivers resupplies via the [[Imprint]] roster.

Bots.Name: Z-Drone
Bots.Content: Created by a [[Z-Drone Bay]]. Slightly better than a [[Mini Drone]], with a makeshift cloaking device.

Bots.Name: Z-Imprinter
Bots.Content: See [[Zion Deep Caves]].

Bots.Name: Z-Technician
Bots.Content: Harmless zion [[Derelict|derelict]] [[Operator]] variants found stationary in [[Zion Deep Caves]].

Bots.Name: Zionite
Bots.Content:
Zionites are weak [[Derelict]] bots with a truly random assortment of makeshift parts (loadout not being awful not guaranteed), living mostly in [[Spoiler]][[Zion]][[/Spoiler]] with useful tips. Can also be found in a variety of events.
Zionites have a decent core exposure and low core integrity, but can overwhelm through numbers.

Bot Groups.Name: A Bots
Bot Groups.Content: A bots are a a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[Programmer]]-like bots that are aligned to the [[Architect]]. A few are friendly to Cogmind, but the majority of them are hostile and can only be encountered at their home base in [[Access_0]]. They have a variety of different offensive and defensive armament and boast some powerful unique parts. They are all formidable opponents in combat.

Bot Groups.Name: Assembled
Bot Groups.Content: The Assembled are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] small swarming [[Hover Units|hovering]] robots that can be found in various infestation-related events. Due to the fact that they always appear in groups, have low core, and have high core exposure, using explosive [[Launchers]] is the best way to deal with them. [[Spoiler]]If a [[Core Reset Matrix]] was used, the Assembled will no longer be hostile and instead be purple uncontrollable allies.[[/Spoiler]]

Bot Groups.Name: Behemoth
Bot Groups.Content:
Behemoths are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of heavily [[Armor|armored]] [[Treads|treading]] [[0b10]] bots that are much more durable and powerful than the majority of standard bots. They typically guard machines or valuable part stockpiles while sitting slightly indented in the wall. Similar to [[Hunter|Hunters]], Behemoths will fire through walls in order to hit an enemy, which makes it hard to hide or run from them. Behemoths can even make use of [[Siege Mode]] to become more accurate and durable in combat. These combination of traits can make Behemoths terrifying encounters if not adequately prepared.
Behemoths have innate EM resistance as well as corruption resistance through [[Dynamic Insulation System|Dynamic Insulation Systems]], so EM weaponry is a subpar weapon choice to get a quick kill. Melee weapons are undesirable to use because most Behemoths pack [[Ballistic Cannons]] that will frequently cause knockback. Behemoths have a minor thermal weakness, though that is slightly mitigated by thermal resistant armor. Meltdown criticals from thermal cannons can instantly destroy a Behemoth from full core integrity (100+), which can save a lot of damage and provide some good undamaged loot. Thermal guns are not effective in smaller numbers, but given enough heat transferring weapons (4+) it is possible to overload their standard cooling and [[Coolant Injectors]] to get the melt instant kill.
Behemoths can be a desirable looting target for their weapons, cooling, treads, and armor. For this reason, applying some positive salvage via Electromagnetic weaponry or [[Salvage Targeting Computers]] can be a good idea. However, it can often be a better idea to run the other way. Even slow treads builds can get away from a pursuing Behemoth with good tactics. Despite their ability to tear through walls in their way, they have a tendency to get stuck unable to path through 1 tile wide corridors. If such corridors are nearby, use them to your advantage. Otherwise, try to cut between connected rooms to avoid traveling through so much of the line of fire. Behemoths will only shoot through up to 3 walls to cut a path, so if Cogmind can turn a corner or get a good angle on the Behemoth where it is unable to shoot, it is possible to wait out the memory.
Behemoths are often found in their own spot inside a wall as part of a [[Security Squad]]. In [[Caves]], they can be found in a small square open area.
[[Gallery]]Behemoths.png|All Behemoth variants and colors|Behemoth Guarded Stockpile.png|A Behemoth guarding a stockpile of parts, sitting in a recognizable "Behemoth nook"[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]][[CR-A16's Pointy Stick]]/[[CR-A16's Behemoth Slayer]][[/Heading]]
A Pointy Stick has a chance to transform into a Behemoth Slayer when used to attack a Behemoth. A Behemoth slayer will instantly destroy any Behemoth and leave them in pieces.

Bot Groups.Name: Brawler
Bot Groups.Content:
Brawlers are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Armor|armored]] [[Treads|treading]] [[0b10]] combat bots that wield an [[Impact Weapons|Impact weapon]] to smash parts of their enemies. They can only attack at short range, but they are frightening for most builds to face head-on due to their Impact weapons being capable of smashing off important utilities while ignoring coverage. Their slow speed means that they have major difficulty in closing the gap on long ranged units without getting killed first.
Brawlers don't have any particular damage type weakness and any ranged weapon types are useful against them. Unlike their cousins [[Duelist|Duelists]], Brawlers don't suffer from a weakness to knockback because the Treads negate any knockback. Since they can easily destroy highly important but low integrity utilities, fighting Brawlers in melee range should be avoided at all cost.
[[Gallery]]Brawlers.png|All Brawler variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]]Squads[[/Heading]]
Brawlers may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Assault Squad]]|[[Garrison Squad]]|[[Patrol Squad]] - [[Squad Leader]] only|[[Security Squad]] - [[Armory]] only[[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Butcher
Bot Groups.Content: Butchers are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Legs|legged]] [[Derelict]] combat bots, armed with Derelict [[Slashing Weapons]] capable of severing parts. They are the Derelict version of the [[0b10]] [[Duelist]] bot but are generally less effective than their counterparts. Butchers are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Cutter
Bot Groups.Content:
Cutters are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Flight Units|flying]] [[0b10]] combat robots that are most often seen in [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcement Squads]] after being summoned by [[Heavy|Heavies]] against flying or hovering bots. Armed with a Saw and Concussive RPG, these units will firstly fire their single-use RPG at the enemy and overload to try and sever the enemy's parts with their Saw. They will overload as soon as they are alerted to any hostile bot. They are harder to hit due to their small size and [[Reaction Control System|Reaction Control Systems]].
Cutters are a major nuisance at best, and a run ender for an airborne build at worst. Their ability to overload makes outrunning them nearly impossible in the long run, even for flight builds. This is even more challenging when their Saws sever essential parts off of Cogmind's body with a single hit, forcing Cogmind to either give up that part or waste essential turns re-attaching parts. The best strategy to kill them is typically a point blank explosive [[Launchers|Launcher]] to the face, as they have high core exposure and low core integrity. Launchering a nearby wall also helps to work around their high evasion. Explosive machine arrays are especially good at dispatching a group of Cutters since they can't miss. A [[Graphene Brace]] removes their sever capability and can make encounters with them much easier for combat builds.
[[Gallery]]Cutters.png|All Cutter variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]][[Squad|Squads]][[/Heading]]
Cutters may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Patrol Squad]] - only in [[Garrison|Garrisons]]|Reinforcement Squad - only from Heavy-summoned Reinforcements.[[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Demolisher
Bot Groups.Content:
Demolishers are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[0b10]] combat robots armed with an [[Launchers|Launcher]] and some form of [[Launcher Guidance Computers|Launcher Guidance Computer]]. They are seen most often in [[Demolisher Squad|Demolisher Squads]] to deal with infestations and as part of an [[Assault Squad]] if Cogmind has allies. They have heavy resistance to explosive damage, so they don't take much damage from their own explosions. Demolishers are extremely dangerous as they can deal out damage very quickly to Cogmind and any allies. Their tendency to destroy terrain can make repositioning difficult and can often reveal Cogmind's location to other hostiles.
Demolishers are one of the scariest standard 0b10 bots to fight head on. Their massive damage and high resistance (or immunity) to their own attacks means that they won't be harmed much by blowing themselves up. Their Shock Absorption Systems are fairly frail, and if those are destroyed they will take much more damage from self explosions. [[Point Defense Systems]] are very useful at cutting down Demolisher damage by intercepting their missiles. Demolishers don't have any particular weakness, so use any non-Explosive damage type available to take them out as quickly as possible.
[[Gallery]]Demolishers.png|All Demolisher variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]][[Squad|Squads]][[/Heading]]
Demolishers may appear in the following squads:[[List]][[Assault Squad]] - Only if Cogmind has allies|[[Demolisher Squad]]|[[Patrol Squad]] - Only in [[Armory]]|[[Security Squad]] - Only in [[Garrison|Garrisons]][[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Duelist
Bot Groups.Content:
Duelists are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Legs|legged]] [[0b10]] combat bots armed with a [[Slashing Weapons|Slashing Weapon]] that can sever off important parts. While they can only attack at short range, they are frightening to face up close with their [[Melee Analysis Suites]] and [[Actuators]] allowing them to hit hard and fast. They also have [[Core Shieldings|Core Shielding]] which makes them immune to direct critical hits and a bit more survivable.
Duelists don't have any particular damage type weaknesses, though their biggest weakness is [[Ballistic Cannons]] because the knockback will help keep a them out of melee range. Other than that, any non-melee weapon is good to use against Duelists. Using melee against them is a little more dangerous since that means Cogmind hast to go toe-to-toe with their strong melee loadout. Melee is a worse idea because of their innate minor slashing/piercing resistances.
[[Gallery]]Duelists.png|All Duelist variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]]Squads[[/Heading]]
Duelists may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Assault Squad]]|[[Garrison Squad]]|[[Patrol Squad]] - [[Squad Leader]] only normally, or in [[Armory]]|[[Security Squad]] - Armory or [[Garrison|Garrisons]][[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Exiles (Group)
Bot Groups.Content:
The Exiles are a group of 3 [[Tinkerer]]-like bots and their bodyguard [[8R-AWN]] stationed at [[Exiles (Location)]] that have been exiled from [[Zion]].
[[EX-DEC]] wields their [[AWS/EX-DEC]] and [[8R-AWN]] wields 2 [[8R-AWN's Boregun|Boreguns]] and may fight if provoked, but the others are unarmed. They have developed a large number of unique prototype parts.

Bot Groups.Name: Fireman
Bot Groups.Content: Firemen are [[Derelict]] [[Wheels|wheeled]] combat bots armed with [[Flamer|Regular]] or [[Enh. Flamer|Enh. Flamers]]. They have a tendency to melt foes due to their high heat transfer. These bots are unique to the Derelicts and have no similar [[0b10]] counterpart. Firemen are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Grunt
Bot Groups.Content:
Grunts are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Legs|legged]] Thermal [[Energy Guns]] users and make up the backbone of the [[0b10]] army. They are by far the most populous combat bot class, being found on nearly every map and in many different squad types. Most Grunts are not especially durable or threatening on their own, though at higher depths ([[Research]] +) they can be dangerous due to their tendency to appear in large groups. Veterans and Enforcers in particular have a significant jump in firepower due to the upgrade from 1 to 2 weapons.
All Grunts share a minor weakness to Electromagnetic damage, which makes EM or Impact the best damage types to use for quick destruction via [[Corruption]]. However, without any resistances to speak of, Grunts are fairly easily dispatched by any damage type. Grunts also tend to have barely adequate cooling, which means Thermal weaponry can can easily build up heat to trigger a [[Meltdown]].
Another way to deal with Grunts is to take advantage of their low memory (20 actions). It is trivial for airborne builds to leave Grunts in the dust, but even a reasonably speedy grounded build may be able to turn a corner and outrun Grunts long enough for them to give up chase. This strategy is more effective when used with [[ECM Suites]].
[[Gallery]]Grunts.png|All Grunt variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]][[Squad|Squads]][[/Heading]]
Grunts may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Assault Squad]]|[[Garrison Squad]]|[[Investigation Squad]]|[[Patrol Squad]]|[[Reinforcement Squad]]|[[Security Squad]] - Only in [[Armory]], [[Garrison|Garrisons]], [[Quarantine]], and [[Testing]]|[[Transport Squad]][[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Guerrilla
Bot Groups.Content: Guerillas are [[Legs|legged]] [[Derelict]] combat bots equipped with an inaccurate yet powerful [[Bore Cannon]] with a high Destroy critical chance. These are the Derelict version of a [[Hunter]]. Their [[Targeting Computer]] somewhat offset the targeting penalty, and they have a minimal evasion boost with a [[Phase Shifter]]. Unlike Hunters, Guerillas have an [[Armor Integrity Analyzer]] allowing them to occasionally bypass enemy armor. Guerrillas are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Hauler
Bot Groups.Content:
Haulers are [[Treads|treading]] non-combat robots that carry parts in or near Complex [[0b10]]. Haulers can carry large amounts of one part or a few different types. They may carry [[Prototype Part|prototypes]], although they may be faulty except for Freighters. Haulers carrying prototype parts are often escorted by combat bots and will always call for a [[Reinforcement Squad]] if attacked, unless a [[Transmission Jammer]] is used along with a [[Transport Network Coupler]]. The jammer alone is not sufficient to block their reporting. They are most often seen as part of a [[Transport Squad]] or [[Cargo Convoy]].
Haulers are equipped with [[Storage Unit|medium and larger storage units]] which can be worthwhile to loot. All Haulers also have a [[Transport Network Coupler]] that can be used to locate other Haulers.

Bot Groups.Name: Heavy
Bot Groups.Content:
Heavies are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Treads|treading]] [[0b10]] combat bots seen in a [[Security Squad]] guarding important intersections and exits. Heavies have a powerful 2 slot Kinetic Cannon and are supported by a variety of offensive and defensive utilities, including the [[Graphene Brace]] that blocks all forms of criticals. Heavies, much like a [[Behemoth]], will attempt to fire through walls and machines in order to attack a target. Their unique [[Active Sensor Suite]] allows them to detect hostiles within a wide radius of 20 tiles, and Heavies may summon [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcements]] when bots are detected and when attacked. They will move between different guard positions whenever a [[Security Rotation]] occurs.
[[Gallery]]Heavies.png|All Heavy variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]]Active Sensor Suite Reinforcements[[/Heading]]
[[Gallery]]HeavySensor.gif|Cogmind walking into detection range of a Heavy[[/Gallery]]
When Cogmind enters Active Sensor Suite range, its radius will be indicated with a yellow flash. While a bot is in this radius, the Heavy may summon reinforcements based on the speed of the bot. If a bot has the [[Active Sensor Spoofer]], the reinforcements will be redirected to a location on the opposite side of the heavy. These reinforcements will not be summoned if the Heavy has active tracking on Cogmind. When a bot is detected, an alert will appear in the log:
[[GameText]]ALERT: Suspicious intruders detected, dispatching specialist reinforcements to area.[[/GameText]]
Faster bots (hover/flight users) detected will typically get [[Cutter|Cutters]] summoned, while all other bots will typically get [[Specialist|Specialists]]. An airborne build may want to go temporarily overweight to reduce the chance of Cutters being summoned. However, the chance is never 100% in either direction. Bots that are actively moving within the radius are more likely to get Reinforcements called, so if a Heavy is moving as part of a security rotation, it may be better to sit still and wait for it to walk by than to continue to move around. If Cogmind has [[Encrypted Comm Array]] support, summoned Specialists may turn out to be [[Infiltrator|Infiltrators]] instead.

[[Heading]]Strategies[[/Heading]]
Heavies are quite sturdy and offensively very powerful. Though there are no damage type weaknesses, they have few weaknesses that can be taken advantage of. While Heavies have sufficient cooling to handle their own weaponry, they are unable to dissipate large amounts of additional heat. Even though the Graphene Brace prevents burn criticals, a few thermal guns with decent heat transfer are still easily capable of melting down a Heavy. A high heat transfer gun like a [[Plasma Rifle]] is a good choice for this. Another weakness of the Heavy is a high dependency on its engine to power its variety of energy-hungry utilities. If its engine is destroyed or blown off, the Heavy will quickly become unable to attack. This is most easily achieved with the [[RIF]] hacks [[GameText]]overload_power[[/GameText]] and [[GameText]]amplify_resonance[[/GameText]].
On the other hand, inferior strategies to fight Heavies are EM and melee weaponry. All Heavies have a form of [[Dynamic Insulation Systems]], and all but the Shepherd have an additional [[EM Shield]] to lower EM damage. Killing via corruption is difficult, and may often take longer than killing with other types of damage. Melee attacks are all 50% resisted by a Heavy, and its cannon will knock back all but a treaded melee build.
Nearly every part on the Heavy makes for great salvage. Try to kill Heavies with salvage neutral weaponry if possible to get the great loot. Applying positive salvage with [[Salvage Targeting Computers]] is always beneficial. [[Transmission Jammers]] are very handy at preventing the additional reinforcements that come when a Heavy gets attacked. A Graphene Brace neutralizes the Blast critical from their cannons and will help protect Cogmind's fragile utilities. Heavies have a very short memory, so the best way to approach is often from a nearby room instead of running down the center of a corridor. If using a Jammer, always consider the Jammer range when approaching a Heavy for combat. Tanking a lot of additional hits to get into range is very unpleasant. If trying to escape a Heavy, the short memory may be an advantage. Once Cogmind turns a corner, the Heavy will often lose tracking before it catches back up unless it is able to shoot its way back into line of sight.

Bot Groups.Name: Heroes of Zion
Bot Groups.Content:
The Heroes of Zion are a group of extraordinarily powerful [[Derelict|Derelicts]] wielding a variety of unique offensive and defensive parts. Heroes come to the aid of Derelicts when attacked and will be hostile to Cogmind if they appear after Cogmind has attacked the [[Exiles (Location)]] or [[Zion]]. However, if Cogmind is in trouble in the [[Caves]] or [[Imprint|Imprints]], they may come to Cogmind's aid instead.

[[Heading]]Lore[[/Heading]]
[[Lore]]0b10 Records|Heroes of Zion[[/Lore]]
[[Gallery]]Heroes.png|All Heroes of Zion[[/Gallery]]

Bot Groups.Name: Hunter
Bot Groups.Content:
Hunters are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Legs|legged]] [[Ballistic Guns|Ballistic Gun]]-wielding [[0b10]] combat robots. They have unique AI where they use their penetrating guns to shoot through walls to get to hostiles. Hunters can also hit more accurately with their [[Ranged Targeting Utilities]] and avoid hits themselves with [[Phase Shifters]]. Hunters also have an innate resistance to [[Sensor Arrays]] and will not show up without a high enough rating [[Signal Interpreter|Signal Interpreters]]. [[Squad Leader]] Hunters also have the ability to launch a [[Drone]] to pursue bots even after losing normal tracking. If the Drone spots a hostile, it will alert the owning Hunter to their position.
Mid-lategame Hunters are one of the most durable standard 0b10 combat bots due to their high evasion. Early tier Hunters are still strong, but the Terminators are a dangerous threat. Using [[Treads]] with Siege Mode or lots of Targeting of your own will help dealing with the high innate avoidance. Electromagnetic weaponry is by far the best choice to deal with Hunters, especially EM [[Launchers]] that don't have to directly hit the Hunter to deal damage. Kinetic builds may have more difficulty fighting Hunters due to their kinetic resistance, though they will appreciate the many Kinetic guns that might drop as loot
Dodging hunters is difficult to do for an airborne build. They have a much higher than average memory (60 actions), they shoot through walls, and they even release a fast-moving Drone to continue the chase. If running from a Hunter, make sure to consider the wall penetration ability because only certain angles will allow a Hunter to shoot through the wall and hit Cogmind. [[ECM Suites]] are of great use in reducing the memory to a more manageable number. Make use of [[Transmission Jammers]] when the Drone is nearby, since the jamming will prevent the Drone from alerting the Hunters of your position.
[[Gallery]]Hunters.png|All Hunter variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]]Squads[[/Heading]]
Hunters may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Assault Squad]] - Only in heavy assaults|[[Investigation Squad]]|[[Patrol Squad]]|[[Reinforcement Squad]]|[[Security Squad]] - Only in [[Armory]], [[Garrison|Garrisons]], [[Testing]], and [[Quarantine]][[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Infiltrator
Bot Groups.Content: Infiltrators are [[Legs|legged]] [[Derelict]] combat bots with one [[Ballistic Cannons|Ballistic Cannon]] and 2 various other guns. They are the Derelict version of a [[Specialist]]. As their name suggests, they are most often seen infiltrating a [[Garrison]], hiding in a wall. If Cogmind has gained some [[Encrypted Comm Array]] score, Infiltrators will sometimes take the place of Specialist reinforcements called by a [[Heavy]]. In this case, they will only reveal themselves as friendly after seeing Cogmind. They come equipped with a unique [[Active Sensor Spoofer]] to mislead Heavy reinforcements.

Bot Groups.Name: Marauder
Bot Groups.Content: Marauders are [[Treads|treaded]] [[Derelict]] combat bots armed with kinetic weaponry. They are the Derelict versions of [[Behemoth|Behemoths]]. They have unreliable firepower, but their [[Slug Cannon|Slug Cannons]] can easily destroy hostiles with their high critical rate. In comparison to [[0b10]] Behemoths, they tend to be more fragile with low integrity in their armor, and are less susceptible to EM damage.

Bot Groups.Name: Martyr
Bot Groups.Content: Martyrs are [[Hover Unit|hovering]] [[Derelict]] combat bots armed with [[Launchers]]. They are the Derelict version of [[0b10]] [[Demolisher|Demolishers]]. They tend to be dubious allies due to their high destructive potential, and quite frequently end up skyrocketing [[Alert]] if kept around. Martyrs are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Mechanic
Bot Groups.Content:
Mechanics are [[Wheel|wheeling]] [[0b10]] non-combat bots that repair the parts and core of damaged allies. They tend to hang around a home [[Repair Station]]. Mechanics will head toward damaged allies as soon as they are hurt but will not repair them while in combat. Mechanics carry [[Recalibrators]] and [[Machine Analyzer|Machine Analyzers]] that can be good to salvage. They also carry a set of backup parts in their inventory based on the bot tier. These backup parts will be refitted on bots if they have empty slots.
If a hurt bot is not shot at for a few turns, the Mechanic will repair core integrity up to 85% and part integrity up to 50%. Allied Mechanics will also repair Cogmind's parts up to 50% integrity but will not touch core integrity. Blue allied Mechanics must be set to Aid before they will repair integrity.
Mechanics can refit parts if a bot has a slot available and fewer than 2 power, propulsion, utility, or weapon slots. 0b10 aligned Mechanics can resupply on backup parts at their home Repair Station. The available refittable parts are based on the type of Mechanic:
[[Table]]
Slot/Count|M-13 Machinist|M-28 Smith|M-36 Artificer||
Power (2 available)|[[Backup Power I]]|[[Backup Power III]]|[[Backup Power VII]]||
Propulsion (4 available)|[[Backup Propulsion I]]|[[Backup Propulsion III]]|[[Backup Propulsion VII]]||
Utility (2 available)|[[Backup Plating I]]|[[Backup Plating III]]|[[Backup Plating VII]]||
Weapon (4 available)|[[Backup Laser I]]|[[Backup Laser III]]|[[Backup Laser VII]]
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Integrity repaired[[/Heading]]
The type of Mechanic determines how much total integrity they can repair:
[[List]]
M-13 Machinist: 800|
M-28 Smith: 1400|
M-36 Artificer: 2600
[[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Minesweeper
Bot Groups.Content: Minesweepers are [[Wheels|wheeled]] [[0b10]] non-combat bots that are primarily found in [[Caves]], often guarded by 1-2 [[Grunt|Grunts]]. They use their [[Datajacks]] to reprogram hostile [[Derelict]] [[Traps]] and extract them with their [[Trap Extractors]]. Minesweepers are always found near patches of [[Dirty Bomb Trap|Dirty Bomb Traps]] and [[Fire Trap|Fire Traps]]. Unlike Cogmind, their reprogram attempts are always successful and they will never accidentally explode a trap while trying to reprogram it.

Bot Groups.Name: Mutant
Bot Groups.Content: Mutants are [[Treads|treading]] [[Derelict]] combat robots that wield a large variety of offensive and defensive parts. They are not exactly the same, but are quite similar to the [[0b10]] [[Sentry]] class of bots as offensive treading guard bots with mixed weaponry. Mutants are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Operator
Bot Groups.Content:
Operators are [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[0b10]] non-combat bots that guard a single nearby [[Terminal]]. Upon seeing a hostile, operators will run to their Terminal, summon a [[Reinforcement Squad]] to their location, and disable the machine. [[Spoiler]]The same effect occurs if an [[Imprint|imprinted]] Cogmind pings a Terminal and the Operator is nearby.[[/Spoiler]] As such, Operators should ideally be avoided or prevented from summoning reinforcements in some way. Operators are good looting sources of [[Datajacks]], both offensive and defensive [[Hackware]] as well as [[System Restoration Modules]]. When destroyed, they drop a [[Data Core]] that provides a one time hacking bonus and reveals nearby traps.
Operators make good allies due to their unique ability to increase Cogmind's hacking power and detect [[Traps]]. Operators within a range of 20 tiles will contribute a 10% (then 5%, 2%, and 1%) stacking offensive hacking bonus per Operator. Additionally, allied Operators will report all trap locations that Cogmind encounters in visual range as long as the Operator is within a 20 tile radius.
Operators can be blocked from summoning Reinforcements in a few different ways:
[[List]]Bot destruction: A destroyed bot will be unable to report Cogmind|[[Spoiler]][[Scraptown#abandonware_association|Scraptown hack]] [[GameText]]HACKBUD.EXE[[/GameText]]: Turn the Operator instantly friendly[[/Spoiler]]|Terminal destruction: A destroyed Terminal is unusable|[[Spoiler]]Trojan(Assimilate): The Operator will be reprogrammed to become a blue ally when it tries to report Cogmind.[[/Spoiler]]|[[RIF]] hacks [[GameText]]block_reporting[[/GameText]], [[GameText]]summon_haulers[[/GameText]], or [[GameText]]formatsys_high[[/GameText]]: Either avoid reporting altogether, turn the reporting to instead summon [[Hauler|Haulers]], or turn the Operator friendly respectively[[/List]]
[[Gallery]]Operators.png|All Operator variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

Bot Groups.Name: Programmer
Bot Groups.Content:
Programmers are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[0b10]] combat bots armed with EM weaponry and a [[Datajacks|Remote Datajack]]. Programmers will attempt to corrupt and hack any hostiles, potentially changing alliances by assimilating them. They can also remove system corruption from their allies and clear certain [[RIF]] hacks from allied bots. They are a persistent threat throughout [[Factory]] and beyond due to being sent as part of [[Extermination Squad|Extermination Squads]].
Programmers are best fought with kinetic or thermal weaponry due to their slight weakness to them. Many cannons are able to kill a Programmer with only one core shot. These weapons are ideal to use. For thermal weaponry, they are also fairly susceptible to heat transfer triggering side effects and an early meltdown. Their EM resistance coupled with their tendency to travel in packs make EM and Impact poor choices to fight them, as corruption death is unlikely.
Programmers are not initially very threatening bots. They deal small amounts of EM damage and appear only in small groups in [[Factory]] depths. However, in [[Research]] they turn into a frequent threat, appearing in larger groups and dealing significant EM damage inflicting consistent corruption to Cogmind. Having a good weapon that kill Programmers in a single core hit is ideal. For airborne builds, being able to outrun or recall Exterminations is a good strategy. Keep in mind that they are fairly fast for combat bots and have a high memory of 80. [[ECM Suites]] are very helpful for shaking Programmers more easily on the run.
[[Gallery]]Programmers.png|All Programmer variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]][[Squad|Squads]][[/Heading]]
Programmers may appear in the following squads:
[[List]]Extermination Squad|[[Patrol Squad]]|[[Security Squad]] - [[Armory]], [[Testing]], and [[Quarantine]] only[[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Protector
Bot Groups.Content:
Protectors are [[0b10]] [[Wheels|wheeled]] non-combat bots that specialize in protecting their allies with remote [[Shield Generators]] and [[Force Fields]]. Protectors are equipped with two power sources and [[Energy Wells]] for higher damage reduction potential. They are most often seen as part of an [[Assault Squad]] or [[Cargo Convoy]]. Later tiers are equipped with [[Point Defense System|Point Defense Systems]] that make it more difficult to use [[Launchers]] against Assaults protected by them.
[[Gallery]]Protectors.png|All Protector variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

Bot Groups.Name: Protovariant
Bot Groups.Content: Protovariants are a group of prototype [[0b10]] bots that appear only in [[Testing]]. They are much stronger than the average bot of each class and can appear in one of 4 states: Unpowered, Dormant, Active, or Disabled/rewirable. They can be made berserk with a special Testing-specific [[GameText]]Control(Protovariants)[[/GameText]] [[Terminal]] hack. If this happens, a special [[Assault Squad]] will be dispatched to their location that contains an [[Investigator]]. Occasionally, Protovariants will go out of control on their own even without performing the hack.

Bot Groups.Name: Recycler
Bot Groups.Content: Recyclers are [[0b10]] [[Wheels|wheeled]] non-combat bots that collected dropped parts and deposit them at a nearby [[Recycling Unit]]. While they are equipped with [[Tractor Beams]] and [[Field Recycling Units]], Recyclers do not actually make use of these parts. Recyclers are a major nuisance for their ability to steal loot before Cogmind can pick it up. If Recyclers are closing in, fire a single shot at them to get them to run away for a while and leave your loot alone. They have the highest salvage potential of any 0b10 non-combat bot, so killing them is a great way to restock on matter.

Bot Groups.Name: Researcher
Bot Groups.Content:
Researchers are [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[0b10]] non-combat bots equipped with a [[Stasis Beam]] or [[Stasis Projector]] which will immobilize their target while active. Researchers primarily appear in [[Testing]], [[Quarantine]], [[Section 7]], and [[Protoforge]]. However, [[Investigator|Investigators]] can show up on any map at depth -3 or higher in [[High Security]] [[Assault Squad|Assaults]]. When a Researcher spots a hostile bot attacking or gets attacked, they will attempt to stasis and scan any hostile and summon a [[Reinforcement Squad]]. Investigators will scan any hostile bot whether it attacks or not. It is safe to dig into a wall that reveals yourself to the Research after the volley. Researchers are also equipped with anti-corruption utilities [[System Guards]] and [[Corruption Screens]].

[[Heading]]Getting Scanned[[/Heading]]
If [[Cogmind]] is scanned in most maps [[Q-Series]] will sometimes be dispatched for future [[Extermination Squad|Extermination Squads]] instead of [[Programmer|Programmers]]. [[Redacted]]Getting scanned in [[Section 7]] can instead trigger [[Intercept Squad|Intercepts]] to start showing up instead.[[/Redacted]]

Bot Groups.Name: Savage
Bot Groups.Content: Savages are [[Derelict]] [[Treads|treading]] combat bots armed with [[Impact Weapons]]. They are the Derelict versions of [[0b10]] [[Brawler|Brawlers]] and have fairly negligible differences between them. Savages are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Scraphulk
Bot Groups.Content: Scraphulks are large [[Legs|legged]] [[UFD]]-aligned combat bots Cogmind can create by using the [[GameText]]Force(Scrapoids)[[/GameText]] hack at [[Recycling Unit|Recycling Units]]. They are similar to scrapoids but are much tankier and individually more powerful with their Ovr. cannon weaponry, and can repair their parts and even core with their [[Scrap Suit|Scrap Suits]]. Their unique [[Partition Strike Chip]] allows them to apply salvage with cannons.

Bot Groups.Name: Scrapoid
Bot Groups.Content: Scrapoids are [[UFD]]-aligned combat bots Cogmind can create by using the [[Scrapoid Pod]] or by using the [[GameText]]Force(Scrapoids)[[/GameText]] hack at [[Recycling Unit|Recycling Units]]. They have little in the way of defenses, but have high offensive capabilities with their unique Ovr. weaponry, and can repair their parts and even core with their [[Scrap Suit|Scrap Suits]]. They also carry a [[CPS Tube]] and can use it while in combat.

Bot Groups.Name: Sentry
Bot Groups.Content:
Sentries are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] or [[Armor|armored]] [[Treads|treaded]] [[0b10]] bots that stand guard around exits, main corridors, and side rooms with machines or item stockpiles inside them. They wield dual Kinetic and Thermal guns at each tier. Sentries tend to be slightly more durable than most other bots at their depth. Sentries typically stand guard alone as a [[Security Squad]].
Sentries have no particular weakness, and so most weapon types can be used to dispatch them. Electromagnetic damage is efficient at killing the higher tier bots, and EM is good in general at increasing the chances of looting their treads and armor.
While combat bots will want (or will be forced) to fight Sentries head-on, airborne builds may want to avoid them or at least avoid getting shot by them. One way to do this is to use a [[Terminology#Partial Spot|partial spot]] to lure the Sentry out of their position. After that, Cogmind may be able to use the guarded machine or exit, or grab the loot without being spotted. A fast Cogmind may also be able to use the long memory of Sentries to their advantage while being spotted regularly. It is possible to lead Sentries far out of position and then leave them in the dust to grab their guarded loot.
[[Gallery]]Sentries.png|All Sentry variants and colors|Sentry Guarded Stockpile.png|A Sentry guarding a stockpile of parts, sitting in a recognizable "Sentry nook"[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]]Squads[[/Heading]]
Sentries may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Garrison Squad]]|[[Security Squad]][[/List]]
Additionally, Sentries will appear at [[Garrison Access|Garrisons]] and 0b10 exits during [[High Security]] and [[Maximum Security]].

Bot Groups.Name: Specialist
Bot Groups.Content:
Specialists are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Legs|legged]] [[0b10]] combat bots with many different themes between each variant. The best description of Specialists are glass cannons. They typically have high offensive output and little in the way of protection. Higher tier Specialists have some the highest damage output of any standard 0b10 bots in the game. Some Specialists also are unique users of [[VSS Leg|VSS Legs]] and its higher rating variants which allow them to walk at a higher speed than most legs (90 vs 120).
Specialists have no specific weaknesses or immunities, so generally any damage type or strategy can work against them. A few have strong cooling and [[Coolant Injectors]] so heat transfer strategies may fall flat against certain Specialists. However, the same cooling parts can also be looted and taken advantage of by Cogmind. Since Specialists are capable of dealing so much damage, they tend to be high priority targets to kill off first.
[[Gallery]]Specialists.png|All Specialist variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]][[Squad|Squads]][[/Heading]]
Specialists may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Assault Squad]] - Only if Cogmind has allies|[[Cargo Convoy]] - Within the escorting [[C-30 ARC|ARCs]]|[[Patrol Squad]] - [[Armory]] and [[Garrison|Garrisons]] only|[[Reinforcement Squad]] - only from [[Heavy]]-summoned Reinforcements|[[Security Squad]] - [[Armory]], Garrisons, [[Quarantine]], and [[Testing]] only[[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Surgeon
Bot Groups.Content:
Surgeons are wheeled [[Derelict]] non-combat bots. They are the Derelict counterpart of the [[0b10]] [[Mechanic]] class of bots. Like Mechanics, they repair ally core and part integrity and have the same set of limitations that Mechanics do on repairs. They also have an inventory of 2 [[Backup Power III]], 4 [[Backup Propulsion III]], 2 [[Backup Plating III]], and 4 [[Backup Laser III]] that they will refer on allies with empty slots.

[[Heading]]Integrity Repaired[[/Heading]]
The amount of integrity that can be repaired by Surgeons depends on the bot type. The Surgeon (4) can repair 1700 integrity and the Surgeon (6) can repair 2300 integrity.

Bot Groups.Name: Swarmer
Bot Groups.Content:
Swarmers are a [[Bot Groups|bot group]] of [[Flight Units|flying]] [[0b10]] combat bots with one [[Ballistic Guns|Ballistic Gun]] that are always seen in groups. They are individually weak and non-threatening, but annoying in groups. Swarmers have a slight Explosive damage weakness. This, combined with their evasiveness, high core exposure, and low core integrity, make explosive [[Launchers|Launcher]] a great idea to use against them. Trying to pick off 6 Swarmers one by one may take much longer and result in a lot more damage dealt to Cogmind.
Swarmers have a very low memory (20 actions). While they may pursue airborne builds quickly compared to most other bots, it can be easy to lose them after turning the corner in a corridor or hallway near max range. This strategy is more effective when used with [[ECM Suites]].
[[Gallery]]Swarmers.png|All Swarmer variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]]Squads[[/Heading]]
Swarmers may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Cargo Convoy]]: Escorts that lead the way ahead of the rest of the convoy|[[Garrison Squad]]|[[Patrol Squad]]|[[Security Squad]] - [[Armory]], [[Garrison|Garrisons]], [[Quarantine]], and [[Testing]] only[[/List]]

Bot Groups.Name: Thug
Bot Groups.Content: Thugs are a [[Bot Groups|bot group]] of [[Legs|legged]] [[Derelict]] combat bots armed with thermal weaponry, uniquely [[Beamcaster|normal]] and [[Hvy. Beamcaster|Hvy. Beamcasters]]. They are the Derelict version of the [[0b10]] [[Grunt]] class. Thugs in [[Mines]] are notable for being significantly stronger than the typical Grunts at that depth, and their Beamcasters are one of the strongest standard weapons available in early Materials depths. Thugs are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Wasp
Bot Groups.Content: Wasps are a [[Bot Groups|bot group]] of [[Flight Units|flying]] [[Derelict]] combat bots armed with Derelict [[Ballistic Guns]]. They are the Derelict version of the [[0b10]] [[Swarmer]] class, and as such, are individually quite frail and nonthreatening bots, but can be more powerful in groups. Wasps are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Watcher
Bot Groups.Content:
Watchers are [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[0b10]] non-combat bots that report hostiles upon visual contact to other allied bots. Watchers have a large distress signal area of effect compared to other bots. If Cogmind has a Watcher in line of sight then an animation will play when the Watcher alerts other bots. Combat bots and [[Operator|Operators]] will all be alerted to your location when this happens, after which combat bots will pursue and Operators will attempt to report hostiles at their [[Terminal]]. Watchers have [[Visual Processing Units]] that allow them to see bots at a larger range than the usual 16 tile range of vision, that can be desirable to loot from them. Watchers also have a unique [[Sensor Arrays|Sensor]] jamming effect while Cogmind is within a certain distance of them.
Watchers are arguably the most troublesome non-combat bot class in the game. Their large visual range, large reporting range, and sensor jamming abilities cause a wide variety of problems for many different build types. The most effective tool against them are [[Transmission Jammers]] which will block their reporting ability. While a Watcher is jammed, it is possible to tell if bots are nearby. If there are no bots nearby, nothing will happen when the Watcher is in range. However, if there are bots nearby, there will be a constant game log message of [[GameText]][Watcher type] distress signal jammed.[[/GameText]]
Watchers are quite difficult to kill, especially the W-44 Eye variant. Their naturally higher than usual avoidance and propensity for running away makes them hard to hit, and a Watcher that lives to run away is a Watcher that continues to summon more trouble from far away. For airborne builds, any melee weapons are reasonable choices to kill them, especially if positioning for a [[Sneak Attack]]. For grounded builds, many EM weapons can kill a Watcher in one or two hits, especially with the high amount of corruption gained. However, due to their low integrity, any weapons will easily destroy them.
[[Gallery]]Watchers.png|All Watcher variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

Bot Groups.Name: Wizard
Bot Groups.Content: Wizards are a [[Bot Groups|bot group]] of [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[Derelict]] combat bots armed with [[Riot Gun|standard]] or [[Hvy. Riot Gun|Hvy. Riot Guns]]. They are the Derelict version of the [[0b10]] [[Programmer]] class. Like Programmers, they can hack hostiles to reboot or assimilate them, remove system corruptions, and remove certain hacks from allied bots. However, in contrast to Programmers, Wizards have plenty of [[Hackware]] and can actually hack [[Terminal|Terminals]] when allied to Cogmind in some circumstances. Wizards are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Bot Groups.Name: Z-Experimental
Bot Groups.Content: Z-Experimental bots are a class of [[Legs|legged]] [[Imprint]] aligned combat bots equipped with a staggering amount of prototype parts, powerful unique weapons, and unique [[Armor]] with resistance to most conventional damage types. Appears in the [[Imprint]] Roster [[Redacted]]and also can come out of [[Command]] cave seals if Cogmind is Imprinted[[/Redacted]]. When summoned via roster, they have a special ally behavior where they will stop fighting and run back to Cogmind if they fall out of Cogmind's line of sight or are too many tiles away.

Bot Groups.Name: Z-Heavy
Bot Groups.Content: Z-Heavy bots are a class of [[Legs|legged]] [[Imprint]] aligned combat bots equipped with many unique Zionite-specific prototype parts with powerful unique weapons. Appears in the [[Imprint]] Roster [[Redacted]]and also can come out of [[Command]] cave seals if Cogmind is Imprinted[[/Redacted]]. When summoned via roster, they have a special ally behavior where they will stop fighting and run back to Cogmind if they fall out of Cogmind's line of sight or are too many tiles away.

Bot Groups.Name: Z-Light
Bot Groups.Content: Z-Light bots are a class of [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[Imprint]] aligned combat bots equipped with many unique Zionite-specific prototype parts with powerful unique weapons. Appears in the [[Imprint]] Roster [[Redacted]]and also can come out of [[Command]] cave seals if Cogmind is Imprinted[[/Redacted]]. When summoned via roster, they have a special ally behavior where they will stop fighting and run back to Cogmind if they fall out of Cogmind's line of sight or are too many tiles away.

Bot Supergroups.Name: 0b10 Bots
Bot Supergroups.Content: 0b10 Bots are a large [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of bots that are found in nearly all maps in the game, and are particularly numerous in [[0b10|Complex 0b10]]. There are a large variety of [[0b10 Combat Bots|combat]] and [[0b10 Non-combat Bots|non-combat]] bots.

Bot Supergroups.Name: 0b10 Combat Bots
Bot Supergroups.Content: 0b10 Combat Bots are a large [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of bots that make up the fighting force of [[0b10|Complex 0b10]]. They are most commonly found [[Patrol Squad|patrolling]] or [[Security Squad|guarding]] areas within 0b10.

Bot Supergroups.Name: United Federation of Derelicts
Bot Supergroups.Content:
The United Federation of Derelicts (UFD) is a major faction of [[Derelict|Derelicts]] that live in [[Scraptown]]. Cogmind can [[Alignment|align]] with the UFD become a member by entering Scraptown through [[Recycling]]. This alignment provides further access into Scraptown along with a few special hacks.
[[Image]]Scraptown Alignment Derelict.png|[[Scrapper (3)]] in Scraptown that gives Cogmind the option to align[[/Image]]

[[Heading]]Further Scraptown Access[[/Heading]]
When Cogmind becomes a member of the UFD, the UFD HQ wall rises up on the map, and a few new areas open up with unique items and bot hacks available as possible benefits. See [[Scraptown#Possible right-side rooms|this page]] for additional details.

[[Heading]][[Optimus]] Alignment[[/Heading]]
After registering as a UFD member, there is an additional option to align 0bPrime for an additional hack, lore, and a lategame event in [[Protoforge]]. Aligning can be done by talking to Optimus in the HQ center area. This will add an additional + to the UFD name in the UI. Aligning will cause a civil war to break out if Cogmind hangs around the map too long, which can be used to grab some loot on the map. However, if Optimus dies in the war, Cogmind's UFD membership is revoked.

[[Heading]]Unique Hacks[[/Heading]]
Several new hacks become available with UFD alignment at [[Recycling Unit|Recycling Units]]:
[[Heading:2]][[GameText]]Force(Fedlink)[[/GameText]][[/Heading]]
This hack hooks up additional Recycling Units to the UFD network. This provides a few more resources to be used for [[Scrapoid]] and [[Scraphulk]] summoning. [[Redacted]]Added resources provide additional support to the UFD during the [[Protoforge]] assault.[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:3]]Resource Mechanics[[/Heading]]
The UFD resource count is a number that is indicated in the terminal after each UFD hack is performed. These resources go up automatically on each floor but are more substantially affected by performing Fedlink hacks. Each Fedlink provides +10 resources on the first hack of each depth, +4 resources on the second, and +2 on all subsequent hacks.
The initial resource count is 20 (plus an additional 4 upon entering -6) if Scraptown is located on -9 or -8. This number is bumped up to 35 (plus an additional 3 upon entering -5) if Scraptown is located on -7 to compensate for the extra skipped Factory floor.
Each depth, the number of resources goes up by a small amount:
[[Table]]
Depth|Resources added|Cumulative free resources||
-6|+4|4||
-5|+3|7||
-4|+3|10||
-3|+3|13||
-2|+2|15||
-1|+2|17
[[/Table]]
[[Heading:4]]0bPrime Readiness[[/Heading]]
The numeric resource count is assigned a readiness value based on whether the civil war occurred in Scraptown:
[[Table]]
Readiness|Civil War Range|No Civil War Range||
Minimal|0-79|0-39||
Very Low|80-99|40-59||
Low|100-119|60-79||
Adequate|120+|80-99||
High|N/A|100-119||
Maximal|N/A|120+
[[/Table]]
For full details of what the readiness values indicate, see [[Protoforge#ufd_reinforcements|Protoforge UFD Reinforcements]].
[[Heading:4]]Example Numbers[[/Heading]]
Here are example numbers of a run with Scraptown on -9/-8 with 2 fedlinks performed per depth:
[[Table]]
Depth|Initial Resources|Ending Resources||
-6|24|38||
-5|41|55||
-4|58|72||
-3|75|89||
-2|91|103
[[/Table]]
In order to hit the maximum readiness by -2, 9 additional Fedlinks need to be performed outside of those 2 Fedlinks per depth, assuming no hacks that consume resources are used. To achieve it by -3, that number goes up to 16 additional Fedlinks.
[[Heading:2]][[GameText]]Force(Scraphulk)[[/GameText]][[/Heading]]
This hack summons 1 blue controllable Scraphulk to the Recycling unit within a few turns of performing the hack. Each hack consumes 5 resources from the pool, and it cannot be used without aligning to Optimus and installing 6 Fedlinks first. The Scraphulk summoned depends on the depth.
[[Table]]
Depth|Scraphulk||
-6 to -4|[[Scraphulk (6)]]||
-3 to -1|[[Scraphulk (8)]]
[[/Table]]
[[Heading:2]][[GameText]]Force(Scrapoids)[[/GameText]][[/Heading]]
This hack summons 5 blue controllable depth-dependent Scrapoids to the Recycling unit within a few turns of performing the hack. Each hack consumes 3 resources from the pool. The Scrapoids summoned depends on the depth.
[[Table]]
Depth|Scrapoid||
-6|[[Scrapoid (3)]]||
-5 to -4|[[Scrapoid (6)]]||
-3 to -1|[[Scrapoid (8)]]
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Alignment Incompatibilities[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:2]]Blocking Alignment[[/Heading]]
The following will prevent Cogmind from being able to align with UFD in the first place:
[[List]][[RIF]] alignment: The UFD will believe Cogmind to be an unaware spy|[[FarCom]], hostilities in the [[Exiles (Location)|Exiles map]], or stealing an empty [[SUBCON Basin]] from the Scraplab in Recycling: Scraplab researchers will say that Cogmind cannot be trusted[[/List]]
[[Heading:2]]Blocked Alignment[[/Heading]]
Several factions will no longer assist Cogmind after UFD alignment:
[[List]][[Imprint]]: The [[Imprinter]] will say that the Imprinting machine requires a more thorough vetting process for a UFD member such as Cogmind|[[Warlord (Alignment)]]: [[Warlord]] will call Cogmind a spy and not perform the -2 [[Research]] invasion[[/List]]

Parts.Name: 0b10 Alert Chip
Parts.Content: Analyzes ambient [[0b10]] signals to guess the alert level. The best part of this item is the reduction of influence by 20%. This item is obtainable from the exiles.

Parts.Name: A7 Data Core
Parts.Content:
Allows entrance into [[Lab]] and [[Redacted]]reveals the hidden intruder-detecting lasers.[[/Redacted]]

Dropped by [[A7]] on death.

Parts.Name: AWS/Thermal
Parts.Content: If the AWS/Thermal is repaired with a [[Recalibrators|Recalibrator]], it will break down in fewer shots than it did the first time. After several repairs, it will consistently break down within a few shots of being repaired.

Parts.Name: Active Cooling Armor
Parts.Content: Obtainable only from a [[Cargo Convoy]]

Parts.Name: Active Sensor Suite
Parts.Content:
The Active Sensor Suite is the most powerful type of [[Sensor Arrays|Sensor Array]]. It can detect all bots, even inactive ones like the [[Exp. Signal Interpreter]] can. Additionally, it cannot be jammed by [[Watcher|Watchers]] or [[Heavy|Heavies]] like normal Sensor Arrays. It also has a unique effect of showing the paths that bots typically travel in, or "desire paths". These paths typically lead through busy corridors and into exits and interactive machines.

[[Heading]]Active Scanning Reported[[/Heading]]
After a certain number of hostile bots are detected using the Active Sensor, an [[Investigation Squad]] will be dispatched to Cogmind's location. This accompanied by an alert [[GameText]]ALERT: Active scanning activity reported from Zone [zone], dispatching Investigation squad[[/GameText]]. The number of bots needed to be scanned varies by the type of bot that has been detected. Once the total detection % reaches 100%, an investigation is summoned, Cogmind's [[Alert]] goes up by 100, and the detection % is reset to 0. Bots not listed in the below table don't count toward an active scanning penalty.
[[Table]]
Bot type|Number of bots of this type scanned to be fully detected|Detection %||
[[Alpha 7]]|4|30%||
[[Armor Guard]]|4|30%||
[[Behemoth]]|4|30%||
[[Brawler]]|15|7%||
[[Cetus Guard]]|4|30%||
[[Combat Programmer]]|10|10%||
[[Cutter]]|20|5%||
[[Duelist]]|15|7%||
[[E-15 Imp]]|20|5%||
[[Executioner]]|10|10%||
[[Fortress]]|4|30%||
[[Grunt]]|15|7%||
[[Heavy]]|7|15%||
[[Hunter]]|10|10%||
[[Programmer]]|7|15%||
[[Q-Series]]|10|10%||
[[Quarantine Guard]]|4|30%||
[[S7 Guard]]|4|30%||
[[Sentry]]|7|15%||
[[Specialist]]|15|7%||
[[Striker]]|10|10%||
[[Swarmer]]|20|5%||
[[Watcher]]|10|10%
[[/Table]]

Parts.Name: Adv. Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Advanced Drone|Advanced Drones]].

Parts.Name: Architect Data Core
Parts.Content: Provides access to the Architect Logs terminal in [[Access_0]] without having to destroy the 120 armor Architect shell that normally encases it. Dropped by [[Architect]] on death.

Parts.Name: Arm. Scrap Engine
Parts.Content: Created from a [[Scrap Engine]] when a [[Armor|Protection]]-type part is fed. See the Scrap Engine page for more details. When destroyed, reverse back into a normal Scrap Engine.

Parts.Name: Army-in-a-Box
Parts.Content: 6 slot utility piece that can assist in difficult situations. Be aware of causing some disturbance in the sector raising the alert level. For this reason this utility is most often best utilized in the caves.

Parts.Name: Assault Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Assault Drone|Assault Drones]].

Parts.Name: Bomb Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Bomb Drone|Bomb Drones]].

Parts.Name: CR-A16's Behemoth Slayer
Parts.Content: Transformed from [[CR-A16's Pointy Stick]]. The Behemoth Slayer will always instantly kill any [[Behemoth]] it hits. Note: This only applies to standard [[0b10]] Behemoth-class bots. [[Marauder|Marauders]] and the [[Superbehemoth]] are immune to this effect. When its effect activates, the game log [[GameText]][Behemoth] suddenly blasts apart at the seams.[[/GameText]]

Parts.Name: CR-A16's Pointy Stick
Parts.Content:
Given by the [[Derelict]] CR-A16 in [[Zion]]. When used to attack [[Behemoth|Behemoths]], there is a chance that this will transform into [[CR-A16's Behemoth Slayer]]. When this occurs, the log message [[GameText]]CR-A16's Pointy Stick's crusty surface crumbles away to reveal its sleek core, which hums to life.[[/GameText]] will appear.
Note: This transformation effect only applies to standard [[0b10]] Behemoth-class bots. [[Marauder|Marauders]] and the [[Superbehemoth]] are immune to this effect. However, it will still transform if used on an allied Behemoth or disabled one, such as the Behemoths that sometimes appear in [[Zhirov (Location)]].

Parts.Name: Chronowheel
Parts.Content:
The effect of the Chronowheel allows Cogmind to rewind time as a one time save/load effect. Attaching saves, and after 30 turns (if not destroyed/removed) the load will occur.

[[Heading]]Timeline of Effects[[/Heading]]
[[List]]
1 - [[GameText]]Spacetime feels off.[[/GameText]] log message. Random part art, map sections, and lore text will briefly flash on screen. The frequency of these effects increases as time goes on.|
20 - [[GameText]]Chronowheel is disintegrating...[[/GameText]] log|
28 - [[GameText]]Spacetime is rapidly distorting...[[/GameText]] log|
29 - [[GameText]]Spacetime reconverges on this point.[[/GameText]] log. Turn before attaching the Chronowheel is loaded, Chronowheel is gone.|
When ripping the Chronowheel off instead - [[GameText]]Spacetime feels normal again.[[/GameText]] log
[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Possible Uses of Chronowheel[[/Heading]]
[[List]]
Determining what map an exit goes to (a very expensive one time [[Signal Interpreter]], not really recommended)|
Scouting out a new map or running through a dangerous area (only really viable if fast)|Getting multiple attempts at killing specific NPCs like the [[Data Miner]]|
[[Spoiler]]Using the [[Data Conduit]] and finding the locations of all locations in the game without the negative side effects[[/Spoiler]]|
Getting the chance to reroll a [[RIF]] ability from a RIF Installer|
Attaching unknown [[Alien Artifacts]] or [[Prototype Part|Prototype Parts]] without downsides. This is especially useful if used with a [[Spoiler]][[Core Reset Matrix]], since it will show where all other Alien Artifacts are on the current map.[[/Spoiler]]|
[[Spoiler]]Completing [[Zhirov|Zhirov's]] [[SGEMP Prototype]] quest and obtaining the [[Access]] map intel without actually getting Zhirov to spawn in Access.[[/Spoiler]]
[[/List]]
[[Heading:2]]Secret second effect[[/Heading]]
[[Spoiler]]The Chronowheel also has a hidden secondary effect when paired with the [[Subatomic Replicator]]. First, the warning [[GameText]]Chronowheel temporarily destabilized by failed replication attempt, a second attempt will likely cause a devastating explosion.[[/GameText]] will appear in the log. A second attempt will give the message [[GameText]]Local interference in replication process, triggered subspace vortex.[[/GameText]] A 20 tile radius explosion will then occur at the point of replication, dealing 1000 vortex damage in 10 damage chunks with 0 falloff.[[/Spoiler]]

Parts.Name: Cobbler Unit
Parts.Content:
Produces one of the following items, some of which are rarer than others:

[[Heading]]Common: ~6.66% (1/15) chance of each[[/Heading]]
[[List]]
[[Battle Cannon]]|
[[Battle Rifle]]|

[[Piercing Trap]]|

[[Scrap Shield]]|

[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Rare: ~0.66% (1/150) chance of each[[/Heading]]

[[Humpback]]|
