Parts.Name: Combat Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Combat Drone|Combat Drones]].

Parts.Name: Companion Sword
Parts.Content:
The Companion Sword is a unique talking melee weapon that can only appear in [[Scraptown]]. It is contained in a room called The Sword, locked for the protection of [[Derelict|Derelicts]], none of whom have survived using the Companion Sword for long. The Companion Sword is quite talkative and will often comment about the state of the run, take pleasure in destroying things, and complain if it is detached or is not the only weapon attached. The Companion Sword has a variety of special effects that are not described by the in-game effect.

[[Heading]]Special Effects[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]
Effect|Description|Frequency||
Surprise Attack|The Companion Sword will "surprise attack" one additional target on a normal attack. Can only happen if there is at least two hostiles are within melee range. The log message [[GameText]]Companion Sword surprise attacks [target].[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Uncommon||
Core Loss|The Companion Sword deals between 5-10 core damage directly to Cogmind's core on a normal attack. Can't be reduced by [[Core Shieldings]] or [[Defensive Utilities]]. Only happens when Cogmind attacks something with the Companion Sword.|Uncommon||
Bot Disruption|A bot is instantly disrupted on a normal attack. As with normal disruption, a disrupted bot can be rewired as long as it isn't hacking immune. The log message [[GameText]][target] shuts down.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Rare||
Sever|A part is severed off of a bot on a normal attack. This effect can hit through the Dismemberment immunity, unlike standard Sever critical hits.|Rare||
Surge of Energy|This effect instantly kills a bot on a normal attack. The log message [[GameText]][target] is pierced by a surge of energy.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Rare
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Transformation[[/Heading]]
The Companion Sword can transform into the [[Quantum Companion]] in one of two ways:
[[List]]Use: The transformation can occur from time wearing and use. Killing bots while keeping it equipped for a long period of time will make it transform the quickest.|[[Subatomic Replicator]]: The Replicator can instantly create the Quantum Companion from a Companion Sword.[[/List]]
When the Companion Sword transforms, the following game log message will appear: [[GameText]]Companion Sword blips out of existence for a moment, then partially fades back in.[[/GameText]] The Companion Sword will also comment on it, saying one of multiple possible [[Companion Sword#upgrading|upgrade lines]].

[[Heading]]Dialogue[[/Heading]]
The following is a non-comprehensive list of Companion Sword dialogue:
[[Comment]]If you turn on "log output" during a Companion Sword run, your entire run's log (including all Companion Sword dialogue lines) will be exported as a txt or html file after the run ends or when creating scoresheet dumps.
Having such a file and using Ctrl+f to find the dialogue lines can make it significantly easier to add missing dialogue lines you might have encountered to this list.
You don't need to do this, but you can.[[/Comment]]

[[Heading:2]]All variants[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:3]]First meeting before pickup[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]You know you want me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I've been waiting for you.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Why hello there. are you here to rescue me?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Want to be a hero? Pick up the sword.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You and I were meant for greatness.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Just do it. Trust me.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]First pickup[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Well that's a relief.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You did the right thing.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I knew you wouldn't leave me behind![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Whew.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I applaud your need for me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'd do the same for you[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Build comments[[/Heading]][[Comment]]This probably belongs to another category, like maybe "Out of combat banter"?[[/Comment]]
[[GameText]]Beware theres a new [second half of build] in town.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"Other weapons attached" complaints[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Using me alongside this [weapon name] isn't good for our relationship.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]This [weapon name] is depressing me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Hands up! Drop the [weapon name]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm allergic to guns and cannons. I might not be able to hit straight in this state. Really.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If you've got this [weapon name], why do you need me, huh?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I suggest removing this [weapon name].[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Why must I share space with this [weapon name]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Do we really need this [weapon name] around? It should just be you and me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You are suspiciously close to your [weapon name].[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm not naming names, but a certain [weapon name(can be gun cannon and melee)] is starting to bug me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]We need to have a talk about your affection for that [weapon name].[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"In inventory complaints/underuse" complaints (start of map)[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]A little more cooperative murder would be good for both of us.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You should use me more often.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"Using other weapons instead" complaints[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]I'm starting to think you like your [melee weapon] more than me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If you don't want me around just say so, oh silent one.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Hmpf.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If you're not going to use me, just drop me and get it over with.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"Detachment" complaints (Companion Sword only)[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Sadness...[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Friends don't sideline friends.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]All the other swords are going to make fun of me now.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]This is my sad face.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Fine, just brush me aside like I'm nothing, see where that gets you.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Now if you don't mind, I'd like you to do the reverse of what you just did.[[/GameText]] [[Comment]]Got this line from a system corruption rejection.[[/Comment]]

[[Heading:3]]Out of combat banter[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]You're looking dapper there, friend. Don't let anyone else tell you otherwise.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]We make a good team.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Fewer friendlies in the world, too bad.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm feeling especially deadly right now, but don't let that affect your plans, it's just a feeling.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You're pretty cool sometimes.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm really excited about what the future may hold for us.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I need buffs.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Together we are unstoppable![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Does that thing on me look more like a heart, or maybe a broken triangle?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A sword and a robot, best of friends.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Have you heard of something called Tec---[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Expand your utility interfacing capabilities, you should see me with more buffs![[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Normal combat[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Powered by friendship![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Gotta go fast![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You can run but you can't hide![[/GameText]] [[Comment]]This one and the next sound like "enemy moving away" dialogues, are they?[[/Comment]]
[[GameText]]Ooh, playing hard to get?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Well there go our bot shields[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A quantum pathway, in I go![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]it's amazing what we can do when we work together.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]This will take no time at all.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Enemy moves backwards during engagement[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Back up all you want, that gives us room to charge![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Looks pretty afraid to me.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]When surprise attacking[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Multipass![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]They can tag team, but so can we! I mean me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Tag team![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Get in line, [bot class].[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Bankai![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Look out beside you![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Do that again![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You look like you want some, too, [bot class]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Surprise![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Watch out beside you![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Boo.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Need a little extra help?[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Disrupt shutdown[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Not so scary now, are you [bot class]?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You can thank me later, let's destroy this tool.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Time-out for you.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A moment of silence for [bot class] here.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Core damage[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Sorry about your core, it's for the greater good![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A little extra strain on your core to speed up their death is worth it[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A little core integrity fora lot of quick damage, good trade yeah?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]This might hurt a bit.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Sneak attack[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Don't worry, I got this[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Sneaky, I like it![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]How did we get so sneaky.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Quiet and deadly![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Not easy to dodge what you didn't see coming, eh?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Never saw that coming.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]It's [bot class] hunting season![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Like ninja![[/GameText]]

I'm not sure what the exact conditions are.[[/Comment]]

Parts.Name: Core Reset Matrix
Parts.Content:
The Core Reset Matrix, or CRM, is a consumable [[Alien Artifacts]] that provides one of the [[Alignment|alignment]] options in the game. It provides a combination of helpful and unhelpful effects, and as such should often not be used in every game unlike other consumable items.

[[Heading]]Effects[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:3]]Alien Alliance[[/Heading]]
[[Assembled]] and [[Golem|Golems]] will turn from hostile to purple uncontrollable allies. Additionally, if [[Imprint|Imprinted]], [[Redacted]][[Z-Light|Z-Lights]], [[Z-Heavy|Z-Heavies]], and [[Experimental|Experimentals]] summoned from [[Command]] cave seals will turn from purple into blue controllable allies.[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:3]]Alien Artifact Detection[[/Heading]]
After consuming the CRM and when entering a new map, the locations and types of all Alien Artifacts are revealed on the map. The part IDs of all Alien Artifacts are also granted to Cogmind.
[[Heading:3]]Alien Language Understanding[[/Heading]]
Cogmind will be able to understand the speech of the [[Sigix Containment Pod]] when rescued.
[[Redacted]][[Heading:3]]Cave Seal Allies[[/Heading]]
If a Command cave seal is opened and Cogmind is not Imprinted or allied with [[Warlord]], cave seals will initially contain 1 Golem and 10-13 Assembled.[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:3]][[Corruption]] Cleanse[[/Heading]]
Corruption is reset to 0%.
[[Heading:3]]Hypermatrix Pings[[/Heading]]
When Cogmind's core reaches below 33%, Cogmind will emit a hypermatrix ping and 6-8 Assembled will spawn next to Cogmind. This only happens on main [[0b10]] floors and in [[Command]]. After this, Cogmind will be able to detect further hypermatrix pings at a range of 18 tiles of other groups of assembled. Coming within a few tiles of these pings with visual contact will cause a further 6-8 Assembled to pop out.
[[Heading:3]]Memory Reset[[/Heading]]
Cogmind loses all map data, part IDs, [[Robot Analysis|Analyses]], [[Schematic|Schematics]], [[Data Conduit|Data Conduit intel]], [[RIF]] alliance, [[A7 Data Core|A7 Data Core intel]], and any manual [[Terminal]] or robot hacks. Notably, Cogmind will not lose [[FarCom]] or Imprint.
[[Heading:3]]Non-Alien Hostilities[[/Heading]]
Certain groups will no longer trust Cogmind as a result of using a CRM. If [[Zhirov]] shows up in [[Access]] as a result of completing the [[SGEMP Prototype]] quest, he and his allies will immediately turn hostile to Cogmind. [[Redacted]]The surrender option is no is no longer offered by [[MAIN.C]], causing the W8 [[Wintypes|Wintype]] to be unobtainable.[[/Redacted]]
[[Redacted]][[Heading:3]][[Sigix Exoskeleton]] Control[[/Heading]]
Cogmind is able to pilot the Exoskeleton located in [[Section 7]].[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:3]]Unique Wintype[[/Heading]]
Taking a [[Surface]] exit after using a CRM awards the W2 wintype.

[[Heading]]Where to find[[/Heading]]
As an Alien Artifact, the CRM is only found in a few specific places:
[[Gallery]][[Redacted]]Lab CRM.png[[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]][[Lab]], guaranteed spawn every game[[/Redacted]]|Quarantine CRM.png|[[Quarantine]], almost every game in unique machinery|[[Redacted]]Section 7 CRM.png[[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]]Found in Section 7 unguarded Alien Artifact Suspension Chambers, random chance[[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]]Section 7 CRM Cache.png[[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]]1-3 can be found in the Section 7 LRC cache, random chance[[/Redacted]][[/Gallery]]

Parts.Name: DRS Beacon
Parts.Content: Used to summon a [[DRS Ranger]] rescue squad in [[Caves]] when activated. Rangers will attempt to pathfind to cogmind and follow them until they leave the level.

Parts.Name: Data Core
Parts.Content: Can be obtained by destroying a 0b10 [[Operator]] whose terminal is still active. Reveals nearby [[Traps|Trap]] arrays if collected before its renewal time expires (40 turns). Additionally improves the chances of one hacking attempt for its associated [[Terminal]] if used before its renewal time expires (40 turns), by multiplying the base success rate of direct and indirect hacks by 1.5 if the base success rate is positive, or raising it to 0% if it was negative.

Parts.Name: Decoy Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Decoy Drone|Decoy Drones]].

Parts.Name: Deploy-a-Sentry
Parts.Content: After deployed, turns into a [[DAS Turret]].

Parts.Name: Derelict Log
Parts.Content:
Derelict logs are items found in [[Caves]], consumed immediately when moved over.

[[Heading]]Possible Intel[[/Heading]]
Most of these usually affect the next main floor, rendered useless if you skip a depth somehow.
[[List]]A number of zone layouts|Trap locations|Machine locations|Exit locations (may also be the same location)|[[Security Squad]] locations|Location of a random floor, or [[Zion]], or [[Warlord (Location)]]|etc.[[/List]]

Parts.Name: Dirty Bomb Trap
Parts.Content:
Dirty Bomb Traps are explosive EM [[Traps]] made and used by [[Derelict|Derelicts]] to defend areas or spring ambushes on [[0b10]] forces. The EM explosions caused by these traps are very likely to cause nearby Traps, including other Dirty Bomb Traps, to also trigger. These Traps are most commonly found in [[Caves]] and [[Warlord (Location)]] and are friendly to Cogmind unless one was reprogrammed by a [[Minesweeper]] that was interrupted before it could extract it, or if [[Spoiler]]Cogmind antagonises Warlord (Location), which will cause all derelict traps on that map to also turn hostile.[[/Spoiler]]

[[Heading]]How to obtain[[/Heading]]
There are three main ways of acquiring Dirty Bomb Traps for personal use:
[[List]]Obtaining Derelict-made ones by extracting them using a [[Trap Extractors|Trap Extractor]] (since they are friendly, they don't need to be reprogrammed beforehand) or letting a Minesweeper extract them for you.
|[[Spoiler]]Fabricating them using a [[Bomb Factory No. 2]].[[/Spoiler]]
|[[Spoiler]]Obtaining the schematic through a [[Tech Extrapolator]] by seeing a [[Heavy Explosive Trap]], a [[Tesla Bomb Launcher]] and a [[Hvy. Missile Launcher]], then hacking [[Fabricator|Fabricators]] to fabricate them. [[Comment]]Since there are no [[Authchips]] for traps/inventory items, i don't think it's possible to fabricate "safely", but i haven't checked if there isn't some authchip type that somehow works for traps, so i'm not sure.[[/Comment]][[/Spoiler]]

[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Strategy[[/Heading]]
There are many ways to use Dirty Bomb Traps effectively. Some ways include:
[[List]]They can be used to corrupt pursuers to cause them to lose track of Cogmind sooner.
|They can be sneakily placed near a defended location in preparation for an attack, such as one of the many [[Caves#outposts|0b10 Caves outposts]].
|They can be placed on the paths of 0b10 squads to destroy or at least seriously damage them without even fighting them. When using multiple traps that way, it is usually better to place them around the squad's path in a sort of V-shape pointed in the direction the squad is going towards, so that one of the squad leader's followers moving on the side would trigger a Dirty Bomb Trap, causing all other traps to also explode while the majority of the squad is standing in the center of the Traps.

[[/List]]

Parts.Name: Dirty Datajack
Parts.Content:
The following RIF hacks can be performed:
[[List]]amplify_resonance|disable_weapons|go_dormant|overload_power|overwrite_iff|reboot_system|spike_heat[[/List]]

Parts.Name: Disassembled Obliterator
Parts.Content: When combined with 3 [[PL-3XN's Ring of Power]], creates [[PL-3XN's Obliterator]].

Parts.Name: Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Drone|Drones]].

Parts.Name: EMDS
Parts.Content:
[[Lore]]0b10 Records|EMDS[[/Lore]]

Can be looted from [[Spoiler]][[Lightning|Lightnings]][[/Spoiler]] in [[Spoiler]][[Hub_04(d)]][[/Spoiler]] or [[Spoiler]][[Quarantine]][[/Spoiler]] or from [[Spoiler]][[Combat Programmer|Combat Programmers]][[/Spoiler]] using a [[Self-destruct Interrupter]].

Parts.Name: Encrypted Comm Array
Parts.Content:
The Encrypted Comm Array, or ECA, is a [[Warlord]]-aligned item that enables summoning various groups of [[Derelict]] allies on main [[0b10]] floors. It can be obtained by performing any of the actions that increase the ECA force multiplier listed below. After this, a Derelict will appear in the next [[Caves]] map and deliver the Array, give some more details on its usage, and reveal the depth of [[Warlord (Location)]]. The ECA cannot be used if Cogmind has been [[Imprint|Imprinted]] or made use of a [[RIF|RIF installer]], as these alignments are mutually exclusive with Warlord.

[[Heading]]Summoning squads[[/Heading]]
Equipping the ECA on any main 0b10 floor will reveal up to 8 squads available for summoning. Each time a squad is summoned, the force multiplier is decreased by 0.01. Moving over one of the squad indicators on the map will summon several white colored [[Alert]]-free allies that will follow Cogmind around the map, but will not follow to any other maps. These bots also do not gain trap location knowledge from Cogmind like purple or blue allies, so they may move over known traps. The squads do not get stronger as depth increases, so they have less utility in late [[Factory]] and [[Research]] depths. All squads have a chance of containing a [[Surgeon]] that will repair any allied bots as well as Cogmind. The available squads are:
[[List]]Chimera Squad: [[Mutant|Mutants]]|Dakka Squad: [[Wasp|Wasps]]|Muscle Squad: [[Butcher|Butchers]] and [[Savage|Savages]]|Geek Squad: [[Wizard|Wizards]]|Ghost Squad: [[Infiltrator|Infiltrators]]|Infantry Squad: [[Thug|Thugs]]|Pyro Squad: [[Fireman|Firemen]]|Ranger Squad: [[Guerrilla|Guerrillas]][[/List]]
If Cogmind meets Warlord at his base, the squad summoning and force multiplier reporting mechanics stop functioning, and there is no point to hold onto the ECA any longer.

[[Heading]]Force multiplier[[/Heading]]
The ECA brings an additional mechanic to Warlord alignment called the force multiplier. This value is reported every time Cogmind enters a new main 0b10 depth. The force multiplier affects several things:
[[List]]The total number of squads available to summon per map. This starts at 0 squads at a 1.00 force multiplier and caps at 8 at 1.08.|Special guard squads in the -2 [[Research]] Warlord assault event. Based on the performance tier, more bots and stronger squads can be summoned to aid Cogmind during the assault.|-1 [[Access]] spillover forces: In Access, additional Warlord forces will appear at the entrance to the map. More squads will appear with a higher force multiplier.|[[Redacted]]The [[Command]] seals will summon more and stronger bots based on the overall force multiplier.[[/Redacted]][[/List]]
The force multiplier tiers are as follows:
[[List]]D: 1.00 - 1.09|C: 1.10 - 1.19|B: 1.20 - 1.29|A: 1.30 - 1.39|S: 1.40+[[/List]]
The following are the ways that the force multiplier can be modified:
[[Table]]
Method|Effect||
Sterilizing a DSF|+ 0.10||
Garrison interior compromised (once per Garrison)|+ 0.02||
Destroying a RIF installer|+ 0.02||
Destroying a Garrison Relay|+ 0.01||
Destroying a [[Phase Generator]]|+ 0.01||
Summoning an ECA squad|- 0.01||
Ascending a depth|- 0.01
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Additional abilities[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:2]][[Infiltrator]] Conversion[[/Heading]]
The ECA has a unique ability that interacts with [[Heavy]]-summoned [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcement Squads]]. Occasionally, [[Specialist|Specialists]] summoned by the Heavy will reveal themselves to be Infiltrators in disguise and turn friendly to Cogmind.
[[Heading:2]]Friendly [[Ambush Trap]] detection[[/Heading]]
The Encrypted Comm Array will detect and reveal friendly ambush traps. When this happens, there will be a log message [[GameText]]Comm Array decrypts allied signals from nearby ambush traps.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading]]Post-Warlord RIF[[/Heading]]
It is possible to install RIF after meeting Warlord. Warlord and his forces will not turn against Cogmind at this point, as they can only detect RIF inside of the Warlord base. However, doing so will lose some of the benefits. The -2 special guards will not appear based on the force multiplier. [[Redacted]]Additionally, fewer squads will be dispatched to follow Cogmind around from the Command seals. However, the seals will still have a higher number and more powerful bots based on the force multiplier as usual.[[/Redacted]]

Parts.Name: Exp. Thermic Cannon
Parts.Content: Obtainable only from a [[Cargo Convoy]]

Parts.Name: Field Lobotomy Kit
Parts.Content: A very popular Exile prototype choice. A common use is on heavy enemies. The further in the game that you can lobotomize enemies, the better.

Parts.Name: Firepult
Parts.Content: After firing, sometimes a log message [[GameText]]Firepult emits an uncontrolled burst of heat.[[/GameText]] will appear. When this happens, a large amount of additional heat will be added to Cogmind's current temperature. The burst of heat starts at about an additional 100 heat when it first occurs. Sometimes, it is followed by an additional message [[GameText]]Several Firepult components seem to have fused.[[/GameText]]. The amount of heat Cogmind gains will continue to increase as more heat bursts occur. Eventually this effect will cap at around the 300-400 additional heat range. Using [[Coolant Injectors]] greatly helps to mitigate the unpredictable heat generation.

Parts.Name: GAL Module
Parts.Content: Found in [[Zion]], with the [[Derelict]] V3-CT5 nearby. When a [[Hyp. EM Gauss Rifle]] is picked up, the GAL Module will attach to the Rifle with the log message [[GameText]]GAL Module attaches itself to Hyp. EM Gauss Rifle.[[/GameText]] The Rifle will be transformed into the [[Modified EM Gauss Rifle]].

Parts.Name: GOLEM Unit
Parts.Content:
GOLEM Units are unique utilities found on [[Golem|Golems]] and in the [[Zion Deep Caves]]. They are contained within the GOLEM Chambers found in the western wall. When attached and activated, they will produce a variety of assembled parts if there are empty slots available. While being integrated, these assembled parts have no effect and 0 coverage. These parts increase by 3 integrity every turn, and become active when their current integrity reaches 100% of maximum. Parts are built in the following order, assuming all slots are empty:
[[Image]]Golem Parts.png|A full GOLEM loadout[[/Image]]
[[Table]]
Part|Turns to build part|Total time to build||
[[Asb. Alloy Leg]] #1|133|133||
[[Asb. Flux Generator]]|117|250||
Asb. Alloy Leg #2|133|383||
[[Asb. Biocell Array]] #1|17|400||
[[Asb. Nanovents]] #1|2|402||
Asb. Nanovents #2|2|404||
[[Asb. Focal Cannon]] #1|52|456||
[[Asb. Alloy Armor]] #1|67|523||
Asb. Nanovents #3|2|525||
[[Asb. Suspension Frame]]|18|543||
Asb. Focal Cannon #2|52|595||
[[Asb. Combat Suite]]|20|605||
Asb. Alloy Armor #2|67|682||
Asb. Biocell Array #2|17|699||
Asb. Nanovents #4|2|701||
Asb. Focal Cannon #3|52|753||
Asb. Alloy Armor #3|67|820||
[[Asb. Metafiber Network]]|17|837||
Asb. Alloy Armor #4|67|904
[[/Table]]
If slots of one type are full, blocking a part, the first part of another type will be build instead. For example, if all propulsion slots are filled but two power slots are open, the Asb. Flux Generator will start building instead of waiting on the first Asb. Alloy Leg. The first Asb. Nanovents will never grow without one Asb. Biocell Array on Cogmind's body, though, as they are both of the same slot type (utility).

It may also be wise to carry an extra power source or significant energy storage, because rebuilding a destroyed Asb. Flux Generator in hostile conditions may be difficult or excessively dangerous, due to the time cost involved.

Parts.Name: Hacking Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Hacking Drone|Hacking Drones]].

Parts.Name: Hacking Suite
Parts.Content: A must-have for when you want to go for a hacking route. Download the schematic and make sure you fabricate enough in the factories.

Parts.Name: Heart of Steel
Parts.Content: After being fed 2000 energy and 2000 matter, turns into an allied [[Warbot]].

Parts.Name: Imprinter Data Core
Parts.Content:
Contains the access codes to open the blast doors in [[Zion]] that lead to the [[Zion Deep Caves]].
Dropped by the [[Imprinter]] on death.

Parts.Name: LC Capacitor
Parts.Content: Found in [[Lab]]. Loses integrity when not attached. Merges with the [[Drained L-Cannon]] to create the [[L-Cannon]].

Parts.Name: Latent Energy Streamer
Parts.Content:
The Latent Energy Streamer uses a unique mechanic called latent energy to fire. At maximum latent energy capacity (100), the true damage potential is 90-100, with 1% disruption and +4 salvage.

[[Heading]]Latent Energy[[/Heading]]
Latent Energy is present all around the map but only in generally small quantities. The most latent energy is present in the various machinery. This means that the Streamer tends to be unimpressive in [[Caves]], but much stronger in [[0b10]]-controlled locations. Each type of machine has a different amount of latent energy it can provide to the Streamer. Generally, larger machines provide more latent energy. Attaching the Latent Energy Streamer allows visualization of how much latent energy is in an area.
[[Image]]Latent Energy Visualized.png|Latent energy visualized[[/Image]]
Latent energy will gradually return to an area after being used to power the Streamer. Generally, all latent energy will be restored within about 30 turns. Some explosive machines will either become destabilized or explode instantly when used to power the Streamer. Any resulting destruction will contribute to Cogmind's [[Alert]] level.

Parts.Name: Lightpack 2.0
Parts.Content: Each time a part is added to inventory, there is a chance that the Lightpack will lose a random part. When this happens, the log will display a message [[GameText]][Item] swallowed by quantum anomaly within Lightpack 2.0.[[/GameText]] Occasionally, the same part may be spit out later with another message [[GameText]]Quantum anomaly discharges [Item].[[/GameText]]. These effects occur more frequently when the inventory is more full. Roughly, one item is discharged for every 4 items eaten. The discharge effect can occur for any part that has been eaten.

Parts.Name: Mapping Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Mapping Drone|Mapping Drones]].

Parts.Name: Master Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys a [[Master Drone]]

Parts.Name: Matter
Parts.Content: Matter is used to attach components, and is consumed by ballistic weapons and launchers, which convert it to the appropriate type of ammunition. It can be salvaged from robot remains, though the available amount varies depending on how the robot was destroyed. Cogmind automatically recycles 5 matter from each attached part that is destroyed.

Parts.Name: Microwarp Drive
Parts.Content:
Microwarp Drives are attachable non-consumable two-slot utility [[Alien Artifacts]] that allow warping across any number of open spaces nearly instantly, at the cost of Cogmind's core integrity equal to 2 per space traveled. "Open spaces" means any tile Cogmind would be able to freely move onto, which includes tiles occupied only by items or doors[[Comment]]Does this include undiscovered hidden doors? If not, what if Cogmind has the Structural Interface RIF ability? What about phase walls?[[/Comment]]. A microwarp will only end upon reaching a non-open space. Microwarp Drives can be found exclusively in the western side of [[Section 7]] as unguarded Artifacts.

Neither hostiles nor Cogmind are able to see any moment of a microwarp, meaning hostiles will not spot Cogmind if a microwarp passes through their FOV but ends outside of it. Cogmind will not be able to see anything while microwarping either, be it robots, items, or map structure, though the specific tiles Cogmind has traveled through will be added to the map as if they had been scanned[[Comment]]Does it only add "empty" tiles to map intel regardless of what type of tile was actually there, or does it add each tile's current state?[[/Comment]]. Microwarps always takes one full turn[[Comment]]I'm not sure if it's exactly 100 time units, but i would guess so?[[/Comment]], regardless of current regular propulsion speed or distance traveled.


[[Heading]]Uses[[/Heading]]
[[List]]
Faster movement - When using slow propulsion such as [[Treads]], microwarps allow moving much faster than otherwise possible, making it easier or just feasible to close in on hostiles, strategically reposition, or flee. 
|Stealth - Since Cogmind cannot be spotted during microwarps, clever microwarping can make it possible to go past patrols and guards without getting spotted.
|Digging - Since microwarps are near instantaneous, they be used to cross any number of dug-out/unstable tiles without any risks of [[Cave-ins|cave-ins]]. For example, this can be used to consistently get from one quadrant of a [[Garrison]] to another without having to go through the Garrison's center.
|Super-cannon digging - By combining microwarps with a cannon capable of [[GameText]]x* Unlimited[[/GameText]] penetration capable of digging very far in one shot, such as a [[Core Cannon]] or a [[Hyp. Alpha Cannon]], it is possible to dig and travel really quickly through long tunnels, and even chain cannon shots and microwarps together repeatedly (at a risk of cave-ins) to quickly move large distances by going around the complex layout itself. For example, with a Core Cannon, this combo can be used to realistically reach [[Redacted]]the western side of [[Command]] without going through [[MAIN.C (Shell)|MAIN.C]]'s chamber[[/Redacted]].

|Lower move count - Each microwarp counts as a single "move" action, regardless of how many tiles were traveled, which can be used to delay or even avoid the dispatch of [[Intercept Squad|Intercept Squads]].[[Comment]]Source: A Beta 11 run i did, where i didn't get any Intercept Squads in Access despite having been scanned by an S7 Researcher. I had traveled 629 spaces, but only done 572 move actions. 568 of those moves were treaded, and 5 were microwarps (yes i know it should add up to 573, don't ask me why it's counted this way).[[/Comment]]
[[/List]]

Parts.Name: Minesniffer Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Minesniffer Drone|Minesniffer Drones]].

Parts.Name: Mni. Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Mini Drone|Mini Drones]].

Parts.Name: Mobile Assembly Unit
Parts.Content: Creates 1 [[Assembled]] for -10 [[Matter]], +100 [[Heat]], -100 [[Energy]]

Parts.Name: Modified EM Gauss Rifle
Parts.Content:
The following RIF hacks can be performed:
[[List]]amplify_resonance|disable_weapons|overload_power|overwrite_iff|reboot_system|spike_heat[[/List]]

Parts.Name: Molecular Deconstructor
Parts.Content: When a bot is hit with the Molecular Deconstructor, they will take the 20-50 damage over a period of 2-5 turns, with 10 damage being dealt per turn. Multiple instances of the damage over time effect do stack with each other.

Parts.Name: Navigation Efficiency Matrix
Parts.Content:
The Navigation Efficiency Matrix (NEM) is a single use [[Alien Artifacts|Alien Artifact]] that will cause Cogmind to teleport at random intervals. When attached, the log message [[GameText]]Navigation Efficiency Matrix installed, partial failure due to system anomalies.[[/GameText]] will appear.
[[Image]]NEM.gif|Effect of the Navigation Efficiency Matrix[[/Image]]

[[Heading]]Teleport effects[[/Heading]]
An NEM teleport behaves similarly to a standard [[Transdimensional Reconstructor]] effect. All bots that are tracking Cogmind will instantly lose tracking, even including some [[Perfect Tracking]] mechanics. However, unlike a standard teleport, the NEM can teleport Cogmind through solid walls. This can sometimes be useful for escaping squads as it will place Cogmind out of sight in a different room. One downside of this effect is that teleporting can repeatedly trigger the [[Watcher]] [[Alert]] increase on sight, as it will forget Cogmind each time the teleport occurs.
[[Heading:2]]Frequency[[/Heading]]
There are 2 "timers" that can activate an NEM teleport. One is based on tiles moved, and the other is based on non-moving actions.
The non-moving actions timer will count up whenever Cogmind performs any action other than moving. This includes waiting in place, so it is not possible to avoid teleports altogether. The non-moving action timer will trigger every 36-48 actions.
The moving actions timer will count up for every move Cogmind makes. This timer is much shorter, and will occur 20-32 tiles moved.
[[Heading:2]]Distance[[/Heading]]
A single NEM teleport will move Cogmind anywhere between 8-12 tiles from the original location. If a [[Subatomic Replicator]] is used on the NEM and two are consumed, this effect doubles to 16-24 tiles moved.

Parts.Name: PL-3XN's Obliterator
Parts.Content: Created from a [[Disassembled Obliterator]] and 3 [[PL-3XN's Ring of Power]].

Parts.Name: PL-3XN's Ring of Power
Parts.Content: When 3 are combined with the [[Disassembled Obliterator]], creates [[PL-3XN's Obliterator]]. can be obtained from a [[Cargo Convoy]]

Parts.Name: Quantum Companion
Parts.Content:
The Quantum Companion is a unique talking melee weapon that is an upgrade to the [[Companion Sword]]. It can be obtained by either using a [[Subatomic Replicator]] on a Companion Sword or by using the Companion Sword for while. The Quantum Companion has all of the special effects that the base Companion Sword has with a higher frequency of occurrence and also has some new unique effects of its own.

[[Heading]]Special Effects[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Quantum Companion Sensors Active.webp|Sensor radius of Quantum Companion[[/Image]]
[[Table]]
Effect|Description|Frequency||
Materialization|The Quantum Companion will materialize in one of Cogmind's weapon slots within a few turns of being detached. If no slots are available, the weapon in the first slot will be detached to make room. Occurs even if the Quantum Companion is destroyed, in which case it will reappear with full integrity. The log message [[GameText]]Quantum Companion materializes via a weapon slot.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Always||
Sensors|After some time in Quantum Companion form, the Quantum Companion will develop 12 range bot detection. Unlike typical sensors, this works on all bots without a [[Signal Interpreter]], even if they have the Scan Cloak trait, and cannot be jammed in any way. However, inactive (dormant/disabled/broken/unpowered) bots will not be detected.|Always||
Surprise Attack|The Quantum Companion will "surprise attack" one additional target on a normal attack. Can only happen if there is at least two hostiles are within melee range. The log message [[GameText]]Quantum Companion surprise attacks [target].[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Common||
Core Loss|The Companion Sword deals between 5-10 core damage directly to Cogmind's core on a normal attack. Can't be reduced by [[Core Shieldings]] or [[Defensive Utilities]]. Only happens when Cogmind attacks something with the Companion Sword.|Uncommon||
Shadow Attack|A shadow clone of the sword attacks a hostile bot at range. Can occur even when not attacking. This attack cannot miss. The log message [[GameText]]Quantum Companion releases a shadow of itself that zips off toward [target].[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens. This attack deals 70-100 phasic damage.[[Comment]]IMPORTANT QUESTION: can this effect occur while a Researcher can see it? If so, would it cause them to notice Cogmind?[[/Comment]]|Uncommon||
Bot Disruption|A bot is instantly disrupted on a normal attack. As with normal disruption, a disrupted bot can be rewired as long as it isn't hacking immune. The log message [[GameText]][target] shuts down.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Rare||
Redirected Attack|When attacked by a projectile, the Quantum Companion will redirect the attack back to the attacker. The log message [[GameText]]Redirected attack with Quantum Companion.[[/GameText]] will appear with this happens.|Rare||
Sever|A part is severed off of a bot on a normal attack. This effect can hit through the Dismemberment immunity, unlike standard Sever critical hits.|Rare||
Sunder|This effect will instantly sunder a bot, similar to the [[Core Stripper]] on a normal attack. All parts are dropped between 1/3 and 2/3 integrity. Affected by the Dismemberment immunity. The log message [[GameText]][target] is sundered.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens. 200 energy required for this effect.|Rare||
Surge of Energy|This effect instantly kills a bot on a normal attack. The log message [[GameText]][target] is pierced by a surge of energy.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Rare||

Teleport|Cogmind is instantly teleported to an empty space next to a visible [[Comment]]IMPORTANT QUESTION: How do the visibility requirements work, exactly? Can you be teleported because one of your drone sees a hostile? Can you be teleported due to having higher vision range due to having a Visual Processing Unit?[[/Comment]] hostile bot at no time cost, through machinery, other bots and even the target itself if necessary. Also sets momentum to maximum, and can be used to trigger an instant sneak attack if the bot hasn't spotted Cogmind yet. The teleport will prioritize closer hostiles, unless some hostiles can be sneak attacked and some cannot, in which case it will prioritize hostiles that can be sneak attacked.[[Comment]]I feel like this last sentence about target priority could be reworded to be clearer, and could also possibly explicitly mention that a teleport will ignore a hostile if there is no empty space next to it.[[/Comment]]
Can happen at any point in time[[Comment]]Can it really? I did a flight run with this, and it always seemed to trigger at the start of my turn (I was never spotted due to this movement, even when it triggered during a wait action).[[/Comment]], and can still happen even if the Companion isn't currently attached, in which case the Materialization effect will be triggered simultaneously[[Comment]]I'm basing this information off of Kyzrati's "swordy run part 2" stream. Not sure if the materialization happens before or after the teleport, but probably before?[[/Comment]]. Be careful, as this effect can very easily send Cogmind into dangerous situations or hinder a tactical retreat. The log message [[GameText]]The surroundings shift and blur.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens. 25 energy required for this effect.|Rare
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Transformation[[/Heading]]
If a Subatomic Replicator is used on the Quantum Companion, it will transform into the [[Superquantum Companion]]. Unlike the base Companion Sword, this effect does not occur from use alone. This means that it is not possible to use a replicator to get from the base Companion Sword and also get the Quantum Companion. When this happens, the following game log message will appear: [[GameText]]Quantum Companion blips out of existence for a moment, then partially fades back in.[[/GameText]] The Superquantum Companion will also comment on it, saying one of multiple possible [[Companion Sword#upgrading|upgrade lines]].

Parts.Name: SGEMP Prototype
Parts.Content: Needed for the [[Redacted]][[Zhirov (Alignment)]] quest.[[/Redacted]]

Parts.Name: Scrap Engine
Parts.Content:
Scrap Engine is a unique [[Derelict]] part that can only be obtained by stealing from the [[Recycling#Scraplab|Scraplab in Recycling]]. It has the capability to create powerful constructs by combining many different parts into one. It can create power constructs of up to 4 slots, propulsion up to 8 slots, and weapons of up to 4 slots. When more of Cogmind's slots are dedicated to constructs, they will also get more powerful overall.
The Scrap Engine can be obtained in one of two ways, with various consequences. The first way is by simply taking it from the Scraplab in Recycling normally. This will cause all the bots in the lab to become hostile to Cogmind, as well as enraging [[Zion]] and [[Warlord (Location)]]. However, if Cogmind visits the [[Subcaves]] beforehand, exits to [[Materials]], and then goes to Recycling, the map will be attacked by [[Subdweller|Subdwellers]]. In the chaos, the Scraplab will have been abandoned, and Cogmind can take the part without causing hostilities.
The Scrap Engine can create combinations of parts that would never be seen normally, such as energy cannons dealing kinetic damage with heat transfer, or 50 speed treads. Modifications to the constructs will only change a few stats at a time, so overall variability is extremely high when using the engine. Modifying a construct with a flight unit may result in a much higher speed, or it may dramatically reduce the integrity and support instead. Every part that is eaten can be a gamble, since the stats that are modified are random every time.

[[Heading]]Processing Parts/Inventory[[/Heading]]
The Scrap Engine can be fed parts by enabling it and standing on top of a part. Once eaten, a part will remain in the Scrap Engine's inventory until it is used for creating a new construct or for modifying an existing one. Up to 10 power, propulsion, protection, and weapons can be stored (counted separately for each part type). This inventory can be used as a pseudo-storage mechanism by preemptively eating a part and disabling the Scrap Engine to prevent use until later. This is more efficient than keeping parts in regular inventory, but is more restrictive since the parts used for modification can't be explicitly selected anymore. If over 10 parts of a given type is fed to the engine, the first part in the engine's inventory will be destroyed.
[[Heading:2]]Broken/Faulty parts[[/Heading]]
The output of the Scrap Engine is not negatively affected by inputting low-integrity, broken, or faulty parts. As such, it may be a good idea to feed these parts to the Scrap Engine instead of throwing them away or letting them become totally destroyed.
[[Heading:2]]Protection parts[[/Heading]]
Rather than going toward creating new constructs, protection is instead used to reinforce the Scrap Engine itself. The first time that a protection item is consumed, the Scrap Engine will turn itself into the [[Arm. Scrap Engine]], gaining more coverage and integrity. Every subsequent armor piece consumed will restore 100 Scrap Engine integrity.

[[Heading]]Creating constructs[[/Heading]]
If 2 power, 3 propulsion, or 4 weapons are stored in the engine's inventory at once, a new construct can be created by combining all of the parts into a new one. Duplicates of a part may be used in new constructions, but at least 2 unique parts must be involved in new construct creation. Note: There is a maximum of 1 power and 1 propulsion construct each at a time, but up to 4 weapon constructs can be created. New constructs are created with a mix of the stats of the original items put into them. The Scrap Engine will preferentially create new constructs as opposed to modifying existing ones.
[[Heading:2]]Naming[[/Heading]]
The names of constructs are generated from a combination of parts processed up to that point. For example, eating an [[Ion Engine]] and a [[Nuclear Core]] may result in a Nuclear-Ion Core. Further modifications may cause the name to change over time.
[[Heading:2]]Type[[/Heading]]
The initial type of a construct will be selected randomly from its original parts. This can cause unusual stats, such as treads much faster than typically seen when created in combination with a faster propulsion type like flight. Like names, the type of a construct can change over time with more modifications. Propulsion constructs gain all natural ability of the propulsion type, like a flight construct granting bot hopping, or a leg construct granting running avoidance bonuses.

[[Heading]]Modification[[/Heading]]
Constructs can be modified when at least 2 different parts are stored in the Scrap Engine's inventory at a given time. For example, 2 [[Aluminum Leg|Aluminum Legs]] would not result in modification, but 1 Aluminum Leg and 1 [[Imp. Aluminum Leg]] would cause a modification, as would 1 Aluminum Leg and 1 [[Flight Unit]].
Each time a construct is modified, 1-5 random stats (generally higher numbers for weapons, lower numbers for power and propulsion) are modified based on the parts that were just processed. Additionally, if there is a slot available, the modified construct may grow in size. The growing chance decreases as the construct gets bigger, so increasing from 1 slot to 2 slots is much easier than increasing from 2 to 3. Additionally, modifying a construct will restore about 1/3 of its integrity.
[[Heading:2]]Multiple slots[[/Heading]]
When parts evolve into multiple slots, some of the stats also scale proportionally. Resource costs always scale in accordance with the number of slots, as will integrity and coverage. Aside from that, primary aspects of the slot type like energy generation, support, and damage will all scale based on slot number. Stats that are percentage based, like overload burnout and critical hit chance, don't tend to change based on slot counts.
One unique interaction between multiple weapon constructs is the ability to merge. Rather than growing into a unique 2 slot weapon construct, sometimes 2 existing constructs will combine into a single multislot construct. The stats of both component constructs will be mixed together into the resultant construct.
[[Heading:2]]Special Abilities[[/Heading]]
Non-standard/special stats/abilities may be given to the constructs based on the type of part eaten. For example, eating a Cld. power source such as a [[Cld. Ion Engine]] may grant the ability to overload the power construct. These special stats/abilities may also be removed at random by further modifications. If a construct has a stat specific to a part type, such as overload on a flight/propulsion type, and changes to a new type that no longer supports it, such as treads, that special stat will be removed.
[[Heading:3]]List of special stats/abilities applicable to constructs[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]
Slot|Stat/ability|Part to consume|Loss on type change?||
Power|Overload|Any Cld. power source like [[Cld. Ion Engine]]|Never||
Propulsion|Overload|Any Cld. flight or hover unit like [[Surge Thruster]]|Change to Wheel, Leg, or Treads||
Propulsion|Siege Mode|Any 2 slot treads like [[Hvy. Siege Treads]]|Change to non-Treads||
Weapon|Overload|Any Cld. energy weapon like [[Cld. Particle Cannon]]|Change to non-Energy Cannon/Gun||
Weapon|Waypoints|Any guided weapon like [[Gui. Plasma Cannon]]|Never||
Weapon|[[Spoiler]]Entropic damage type, additionally loss of integrity per shot[[/Spoiler]]|[[Spoiler]]Any Vortex weapon like [[Vortex Rifle]][[/Spoiler]]|Never
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Part destruction[[/Heading]]
Unlike most parts, constructs are not always instantly destroyed when they run out of integrity. Any multislot parts are instead reduced in slot count and partially restored in integrity. Though the slot may be hard to regrow again, it does make constructs more resilient than they first might appear. The only exception to this rule is that a Vortex weapon construct will be entirely destroyed if it runs out of integrity due to being fired.
When any construct is forced to shrink in size via damage, fully destroyed, or manually removed, the Scrap Engine will be slightly damaged in the process, reporting that [[GameText]]Scrap Engine damaged due to network destabilization[[/GameText]].

[[Heading]]General Strategies[[/Heading]]
Scrap Engine tends to be a very powerful but often unreliable part. It can generate abnormally powerful constructs, far outstripping anything else available, and then snatch the positive aspects of them away and leave you with a weapon that generates 400 heat per shot. As such, making modifications with a lot of spare parts around is always a good idea to reduce the chance of getting stuck with a hard to use part. On the other hand, if a great construct is created, it may often be worth postponing further modifications until needed to repair integrity. Otherwise, the best qualities may be lost before long.
A good strategy is to approach the modifications with moderation. Going all in on thermal energy cannons may result in a high damaging high meltdown weapon, but may also spike your own heat generation past reasonable levels. Mixing in lower heat generating kinetic guns and cannons will tend to balance your weapons out with more sustainable energy and heat resource costs. Propulsion can be approached similarly. Eating a mixture of hover, legs, and tread propulsion will tend toward middle of the road constructs that aren't amazing at anything in particular, but you will rarely end up with the excessive highs and lows that can occur if only one type of propulsion is focused on. Additionally, being more lenient in what you eat will help keep constructs topped off on integrity.
For a higher risk higher reward approach, mixing extremes like treads and flight can result in some incredibly overpowered propulsion constructs. A primarily treads-orientated propulsion construct only needs a single good flight modification to take the speed down to close to the 40 speed range. However, bad modification can instead lose lots of integrity or support. Doing this is safer with a lot of spare parts to eat in case things go south. Another example of a beneficial extreme is combining high critical rate Hyp. weapons like [[Hyp. Gauss Cannon]] with meltdown criticals from thermal cannons. It is possible to create an abnormally high meltdown critical % weapon this way, at the risk of losing some weapon damage.
[[Heading:2]]Multi-projectile Weapons[[/Heading]]
[[Flak Gun|Flak Guns]] can produce excellent constructs due to their high projectile count. While some stats get reduced to compensate for the increased projectile count, it is still possible to achieve overall high damage and a high critical percent chance. It is even possible to go beyond the original weapon's projectile count (6 in the case of Flak Guns). Heat transfer is another good stat to apply to a large projectile construct. A high heat transfer combined with a high projectile count can melt bots nearly instantly.
[[Heading:2]]Miscellaneous Tips[[/Heading]]
[[List]]Have a stockpile of parts before equipping the Scrap Engine - Recycling is a good place to get a strong start on constructs due to the large number of different types of parts to eat, and the lack of big threats. If saving Scrap Engine for later, try to create a good sized loot pile ahead of time to get a head start on growing the constructs.|
Don't go all in on EM damage - If all of your weapon slots are a single construct of EM type damage and you run into a [[Programmer]], you're going to have a rough time.|
Be careful of destroying cover - Construct weapons tends to be much more powerful than typical weapons and will blow through walls right and left. This is good in some situations, but it can also leave you wide open to multiple angles of attack.|
Leave a slot open for a [[Launchers]] - Dedicating all of your weapon slots to constructs makes it hard to deal with [[Swarmer|
Swarmers]] or other large groups of hostiles.|
Make careful [[Storage Unit|
Storage]] selections - Larger storage units like [[Hcp. Storage Unit]] and above may be difficult to carry if flight and hover propulsion are eaten. Smaller storage units can be carried more easily without overweight penalties with a bad support modifications.|
Modify constructs with slots open - If trying to grow a construct, make sure that an empty slot is available for growth. This is especially the case for weapon constructs. Even though two weapon constructs may occasionally merge into a single multislot construct, it is more reliable to grow the slot number by keeping one available.|
Don't have more than 3 weapons in engine inventory at a time - If trying to grow a weapon construct in number of slots, having 4 parts in inventory with an open weapon slot will always result in a new construct being created rather than having the existing construct modified. It may take a little longer, but making sure to process only 2 at a time will ensure maximum modifications and the highest chance to grow a weapon construct in slot count.|
Take Alignments - [[Warlord (Alignment)]] and [[Imprint]] can both be the source of great parts to feed the scrap engine. Note that in order to align, Cogmind must have taken the Scrap Engine from a Subdweller-attacked Recycling, otherwise the associated maps will be hostile.[[/List]]

Parts.Name: Seismic Detector
Parts.Content:
The Seismic Detector is an unusual piece of [[Infowar]] that can detect nearby seismic activity with a radius of 22. In-game, this is represented by flashing orange to yellow colors. More intense activity is indicated by a bright yellow color, while less intense activity fades down to a dark orange. There are several major components of seismic activity that can be detected with this part:
[[List]]
Robot movement detection: Bots that move on [[Wheels]], [[Legs]], or [[Treads]] will cause varying amounts of seismic activity. Wheel movement is indicated by dark orange color and is typically only 1-2 tiles long. Leg movement is indicated by a bright orange color and can typically be 2-4 tiles long. Tread movement is indicated by a bright yellow color and is typically 3-4 tiles long. Bots that are [[Hover Unit|hovering]], [[Flight Unit|flying]], or not moving do not create any seismic activity.|
Active machine detection: Certain machines create seismic activity. Note that [[Interactive Machine|Interactive Machines]] such as [[Terminal|Terminals]] do not create any seismic activity, but many non-interactive machines do, especially in [[Factory]].
[[Comment]]TODO: Could make a full list of machines that can be detected.[[/Comment]]|
Explosion detection: Explosions create very large areas of intense bright yellow seismic activity.[[/List]]
[[Image]]Seismic Detector Activating.webp|The Seismic Detector being activated[[/Image]]

[[Heading]]Analysis[[/Heading]]
Seismic Detector can be used both as a primary yet somewhat limited source of infowar or with a combination of other infowar parts effectively.
[[Heading:2]]Pros/Cons[[/Heading]]
[[List]](+) Swappable single slot: Other sources of infowar such as [[Sensor Arrays]] and [[Terrain Scanners]] can take 2 slots to use to maximum effectiveness, while the Seismic Detector only requires 1 slot and can be easily swapped during combat.|
(+) Long range: 22 range is one of the largest ranges of infowar in the game for bot detection in the game and is 6 tiles longer than the default sight range.|
(+) Machine detection (sometimes): While inconsistent at best, the Seismic Detector can occasionally give a rough idea of the size and position of rooms due to seismic activity-generating machines inside of them.|
(+) Non-jammability: Unlike Sensor Arrays, Seismic Detectors can't be jammed by [[Watcher|Watchers]] or [[Heavy|Heavies]] and is also immune to the map-wide scrambling effect of the Phase Generator in [[Garrison|Garrisons]] and [[Command]].|
(+) Detection of [[Investigation Squad|Investigation]] and [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcement Squads]]: Since these squads typically contain all grounded bots like [[Grunt|Grunts]] and [[Hunter|Hunters]], these squads can be detected and avoided from far away.|
(-) Difficulty to decipher: It takes some time to learn how to interpret seismic readings. It is also hard to keep track of all the movement going on in busy areas. ARCs can often blend in with non-combat wheeled bots.|
(-) Inability to detect hovering/flying bots: While the Seismic Detector can point out squads of grounded bots including [[C-30 ARC|ARCs]] in [[Patrol Squad|Patrol Squads]], it will fail to detect other common [[Programmer]] or [[Swarmer]] patrol squads. Other problematic bots that will fail to be detected are Watchers and [[Operator|Operators]].|(-) Inability to detect guards: [[Sentry|Sentries]], [[Behemoth|Behemoths]], and other types of [[Security Squad|Security Squads]] are all immobile under normal circumstances and cannot be detected.[[/List]]
[[Heading:2]]General Strategy/Usage[[/Heading]]
If being used as the main source of bot detection, Cogmind should be prepared to deal with bots that the Seismic Detector can't detect. Swarmers, Programmers, Sentries, and Behemoths are the primary combat bots that fall under this category. While most of these bots are fairly common to encounter anyway, lack of Behemoth detection is a major shortcoming. Combat builds are typically more suited than stealth builds to handle its limitations as a solo infowar part. While the bot detection is quite powerful, absolute stealth is not an option. For flight especially, running into Programmers and Swarmers unexpectedly can often lead to dangerous situations.
The Seismic Detector is very good at helping Cogmind avoid Investigations and Reinforcements. [[Spoiler]]The downside of Force hacks summoning an Investigation squad is less of a downside if the Investigation can be avoided. [[UFD]] alignment often wants to perform a lot of Force hacks, so Seismic Detector makes a good combo.[[/Spoiler]]
[[Heading:3]]Good Part Combos[[/Heading]]
Some other infowar utilities have traits that synergize well with the Seismic Detector.
[[Heading:4]]Sensor Arrays[[/Heading]]
While it may seem redundant, Seismic Detector can be paired effectively with Sensor Arrays, both with or without [[Signal Interpreters]]. In both cases, Seismic Detector boasts a superior range and an inability to be jammed or scrambled.
Seismic Detector and interpreter-less sensors can cover large weaknesses of each other. Normally, an interpreter with a high enough rating is required to detect Hunters. However, if a bot shows up with seismic activity but not on the sensor, it is either within a Heavy's jamming range or a Hunter. Conversely, bots that show up on sensors but not the Seismic Detector are either hovering or flying or are stationary. All bots are detectable with this combination of 2 parts, and both utilities both be swapped off during combat. One downside of this combo is that the class of bots is never known for certain and must be guessed based on behavior.
For sensors with an interpreter, there is still one advantage of Seismic Detector that is worth mention. [[H-88 Terminator|H-88 Terminators]] are a particular scary bot to fight and are found in large numbers in -2 and -1. They require an [[Exp. Signal Interpreter]] to be seen on sensors, which is a rare part to find on the ground. The Seismic Detector will detect these Hunters as long as they are moving.
[[Heading:4]]Terrain Scanners[[/Heading]]
One of the biggest weaknesses of the Seismic Scanner is the inability to detect Sentries and Behemoths. Since their positions are fixed and often buried in a nook within walls, good terrain scanning can locate these bots even when the Seismic Detector cannot. This requires a decently rated [[Terrain Scan Processors|Terrain Scan Processor]] as the base scanning speed is too low to consistently locate these spots.
[[Heading:4]][[Transmission Jammers]][[/Heading]]
While Transmission Jammers are universally useful, being able to jam Watchers is particularly useful since many bot types may not always be detected ahead of time, avoiding scenarios where a Watcher alerts a yet unnoticed Behemoth or nearby squad.
[[Heading:4]][[Cloaking Device|Cloaking Devices]]/[[Visual Processing Units]][[/Heading]]
Both of these parts serve a similar effect in terms of Seismic Detector synergy. Having a sight advantage can allow Cogmind to visually spot bots that the Seismic Detector wouldn't pick up. The bots can then either be fought or avoided after their location has been identified.

[[Heading]]Examples of seismic activity[[/Heading]]
[[Gallery]]Seismic Detector Prop Types.gif|Different propulsion types. Treads on top, Legs in middle, Wheels on bottom.|
Seismic Detector Grunt Patrol.gif|5 Grunts in a patrol squad|
Seismic Detector ARC Patrol.gif|ARC in a patrol squad|

Parts.Name: Sensor Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Sensor Drone|Sensor Drones]].

Parts.Name: Sigix Containment Pod
Parts.Content:
The Sigix Containment Pod can be found in [[Quarantine]]. It has no gameplay effect by itself, but it enables the W3 [[Wintypes|Wintype]] and provides 5000 bonus score if carried to a win.
[[Redacted]]The Sigix Containment Pod can be put in the [[Sigix Exoskeleton]] in [[Section 7]] to create an allied [[Sigix Warrior]].[[/Redacted]]

Parts.Name: Sigix Corpse
Parts.Content: Provides 2000 bonus score if carried to a win.

Parts.Name: Sigix Exoskeleton
Parts.Content:
[[Image]]Section 7 Sigix Exoskeleton.png|The Exoskeleton room in Section 7[[/Image]]
The Sigix Exoskeleton is an [[Alien Artifacts|Alien Artifact]] that is only found in [[Section 7]]. Initially it is found on an unpowered [[Sigix Warrior]] named Sigix Exoskeleton in the bottom right corner of the hangar. If Cogmind has used a [[Core Reset Matrix]] (CRM), it is possible to enter the Exoskeleton, which dramatically alters gameplay for the rest of the current run.

[[Heading]]Unique effects[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:3]]Additional Core Damage[[/Heading]]
Roughly 1/3 of all damage dealt to the Sigix Exoskeleton is also dealt to Cogmind's core.
[[Heading:3]]Alien Weapon Damage Boost[[/Heading]]
All non-AOE attacks from Sigix weapons is doubled. However, this effect does not stack with things like [[Particle Chargers]]. The full list of affected weapons is as follows: [[Core Cannon]], [[Core Stripper]], [[Modified Sigix Sheargun]], [[Sigix Broadsword]], [[Sigix Shearcannon]], and [[Sigix Sheargun]]
[[Heading:3]][[Assembled]] Absorption[[/Heading]]
While the Exoskeleton is damaged, Assembled can be absorbed to repair it by 30 integrity when standing next to Cogmind.
[[Heading:3]]Core Dependence[[/Heading]]
Cogmind's core becomes dependent on the Exoskeleton. Even if Cogmind still has remaining core, if the Exoskeleton is destroyed the game will instantly be loss.
[[Heading:3]]Enhanced Hypermatrix Pings[[/Heading]]
Whenever entering a new floor with Assembled spawns available (all main 0b10-controlled floors, [[DSF|DSFs]], and [[Command]]), 6-8 Assembled will appear near Cogmind. Additionally, the Exoskeleton provides the CRM's hypermatrix ping detection and Assembled summoning ability at all times rather than only while at 1/3 core.
[[Heading:3]]Damage Reduction[[/Heading]]
The Exoskeleton provides a 50% damage resistance to all conventional damage types. This effect stacks with most [[Defensive Utilities]], but not with [[Resistance Devices]].
[[Heading:3]]Deactivation-Proof[[/Heading]]
The Exoskeleton cannot be deactivated by any means. This includes manual deactivation as well as [[Heat]]-based side-effects.
[[Heading:3]]Infowar[[/Heading]]
The Exoskeleton provides extremely powerful sensor intel in an 18 tile radius. Perfect bot detection, terrain scanning, part detection, and hidden door detection is granted within this radius.
[[Heading:3]]High Coverage[[/Heading]]
While not exactly a unique ability, the Exoskeleton has a uniquely high 30,000 coverage which dwarfs every other item's coverage in the game. Most typical forms of armor are entirely unhelpful with the Exoskeleton equipped.
[[Heading:3]][[Maximum Security]] Triggering[[/Heading]]
As soon as Cogmind is spotted by any combat hostile in most [[0b10]]-controlled maps, Maximum Security will be immediately engaged. One notable exception is that Maximum Security will not be triggered in Command. Non-combat [[Watcher|Watchers]] and [[Operator|Operators]] whose associated [[Terminal]] hasn't be destroyed will also trigger this effect.
[[Image]]Exoskeleton4x.png|Cogmind's new look[[/Image]]
[[Heading:3]]New Appearance[[/Heading]]
Cogmind will take on the Sigix Warrior artwork, or the uppercase X character in ASCII mode.
[[Heading:3]]Slot Fixing[[/Heading]]
When Cogmind enters the Exoskeleton, all slots will be reset to a total of 1 Power, 3 Propulsion, 3 Utility, and 2 Weapon slots. However, Cogmind gets some boosts in exchange for the slots. Cogmind gains 100 fixed energy capacity, and every slot above the new 9 total slot count provides 3 innate energy generation and 5 heat dissipation. Not counting [[Core Expander|Core Expanders]], a typical -3 Section 7 provides 36 energy and 60 dissipation while a -2 Section 7 provides 42 energy and 70 dissipation. Slots can be evolved as normal after entering the Exoskeleton, including using Core Expanders. As a side-note, a [[Core Physics Calibrator]] cannot remove the 3 propulsion slots and force removal of the Exoskeleton.
[[Heading:3]]UI Intel[[/Heading]]
There are 4 new pieces of intel located at the bottom of the inventory UI:
[[List]]Threats: Counts the number of active hostiles within sensor radius.|Components: Counts the number of parts on the floor within sensor radius.|Ping number: Counts the number of active but untriggered Assembled hypermatrix pings.|Tor distance: Lists the distance to the Tor, the Sigix spaceship. The number in thousands place varies based on the map, but up to the hundreds place, it roughly indicates how many tiles Cogmind must travel to get to the nearest [[Surface]] exit.[[/List]]
[[Heading:3]]Unique Interactions[[/Heading]]
Cogmind becomes indistinguishable from a Sigix Warrior to some NPCs. [[Warlord]] will turn aggressive upon seeing Cogmind during the -2 [[Research]] attack or when summoned via Command cave seals. [[MAIN.C]] has unique encounter dialogue and a special phase 2 encounter after the outer shell is defeated, summoning 4 additional [[M Shell/Atk]] and 4 [[M Shell/Def]]s to his side. The [[Architect]] will recognize Cogmind, but also has unique encounter dialogue.

Parts.Name: Spacefold Activator
Parts.Content:
Spacefold Activators are attachable non-consumable utility [[Alien Artifacts]] that allow moving through up to 3 solid objects, at a cost of Cogmind's core integrity equal to 1% of maximum for each space traveled. They can be found exclusively in the western side of [[Section 7]] as unguarded Artifacts.

Note that the core integrity cost is for every space traveled during a spacefold, and not for every solid object, meaning that the tile that Cogmind ends up on also counts. For example, a spacefold through 2 walls would cost 3% core integrity, 2% for the wall and 1% for the tile Cogmind ends up on.

[[Heading]]Uses[[/Heading]]
There are many Alien Artifacts or even regular items that can replace some of the Spacefold Activator's uses or at least allow for the same overall results, without the high core integrity cost. However, a Spacefold Activator is capable of a more versatile range of movements than any single one of those items, while also being precise, consistent and only taking up one slot.

[[List]]Spacefolds can be used to bypass Reinforced Barriers, Sealed Heavy Doors and other difficult-to-destroy obstacles, without causing any [[Alert]] gain or requiring hacking. Since none of those obstacles are ever larger than 3 tiles, the only cases where spacefolds fail is when those obstacles contain a solid object within, such as allied [[Derelict|Derelicts]] imprisoned within small cells in [[Garrison|Garrisons]]. As with some other travel methods, going past Sealed Heavy Doors and the like may cause 0b10 to eventually open them to allow combat robots to chase down Cogmind, especially if there is no other way through, which can make it possible for allies to go through as well.|

Spacefolds can be used to quickly get out of rooms or corridors when patrols or other dangers are approaching and into safer or more strategic locations, without creating any additional paths for those dangers to reach said locations. This is much faster than digging through walls, especially if there are multiple layers of solid objects in the way, and won't destroy any [[Interactive Machine|interactive machines]] that might have been in the way.|

Spacefolds can allow for longer-range safe [[Digging|digs]]. While a [[Microwarp Drive]] allows for an even longer safe digging range and a lower core integrity loss, Spacefold Activators only take up one slot and cannot cause Cogmind to go farther than expected. [[Comment]]I don't know how spacefolding affects cave-ins, but if the only thing that matters is dug-out tiles traversed and "not-dug-out-but-diggable" spaces don't matter, then it should be possible to do stuff like an eight-tile dig, by digging five tiles to create a "waypoint", then digging once to the side to create a spot where you can spacefold to the waypoint, making the full movement = Dug-out-tile -> 3-tile spacefold -> "waypoint" -> 3-tile spacefold -> destination.[[/Comment]]

[[/List]]

Parts.Name: Splice Drone Bay
Parts.Content: Deploys [[Splice Drone|Splice Drones]].

Parts.Name: Stasis Trap
Parts.Content:
Stasis Traps are [[Traps]] found in 0b10-controlled areas, and are especially common in [[Garrison|Garrisons]]. They are uniquely the only trap type to temporarily remain after being triggered, the only extractable trap type that cannot be stored inside [[Trap Extractors]], as well as the only trap type to be extractable [[I]]after[[/I]] being triggered (but before being depleted).

[[Heading]]Triggering[[/Heading]]
While the probability of triggering traps is based on current [[Propulsion]] type, the probability of triggering Stasis Trap is the opposite of regular Traps :
[[Table]]
Mode|Probability| Min. depletion on move
|| Overweight | 100% | N/A
|| [[Treads]] | 0% | 30
|| [[Legs]] | 25% | 15
|| [[Wheels]] | 50% | 10
|| [[Hover Units|Hover]] | 60% | 7
|| Core | 60% | 6
|| [[Flight Units|Flight]] | 80% | 5
[[/Table]]
Note that this means non-overweight threaded builds are "immune" to hostile Stasis Traps.

[[Heading]]Effects and depletion[[/Heading]]
Upon being triggered, Stasis Traps create a stasis field on the tile they occupy, which cancels the evasion bonus from [[Flight Units|Flight]]/[[Hover Units|Hover]]/[[Reaction Control Systems]] of robots inside and prevents them from moving away until the field is depleted, usually by the victim's repeated movement attempts. These traps pose no threat whatsoever on their own, but with bad timing can be can cause Cogmind to get stuck in exposed locations as nearby dangers approach the area. However, the stasis field also reduces all incoming damage by 25%.
The stasis field's strength starts at 100 minus whatever one movement of the victim would deplete, and can be escaped in one of five ways:
[[List]]
Attempting to move away from the stasis field will cause it to deplete by an amount equal to ([current mass support] - [current mass]) OR a minimum dependent on propulsion type (see table above), whichever is larger.
Note that attempting to move away always takes 1 turn, regardless of current movement speed, with the exception of the movement that finishes depleting the field.
|Taking damage while in a stasis field will reduce that damage by 25% and deplete the stasis field by [damage absorbed].
|Using a [[Stasis Canceller]] and moving away from the trap will deplete it instantly.
|If the Stasis Trap is friendly, using a Trap Extractor will extract it and its stasis field, conserving whatever was left of the field strength.
|If an explosion occurs and destroys the Stasis Trap itself, the stasis field will also disappear, and the corresponding [[Mechanics Achievements|Mechanics Achievement]] "Short-term Sacrifices" will be unlocked if it wasn't already.
[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Special Interactions[[/Heading]]
Below is an incomplete list of special interactions with Stasis Traps:
[[List]]Cogmind is capable of swapping with allies already in Stasis Traps, which frees the ally but traps Cogmind instead.
|[[Spoiler]]A [[Field Manipulator]] allows taking greater advantage of Stasis Traps' defensive ability.[[/Spoiler]]
[[/List]]



Last edited during Beta 15.

Parts.Name: Superquantum Companion
Parts.Content: The Superquantum Companion is a unique talking melee weapon that is an upgrade to the [[Quantum Companion]]. It can be obtained by using a [[Subatomic Replicator]] on the Quantum Companion. The Superquantum Companion has [[Quantum Companion#special_effects|all of the effects]] that the Quantum Companion does, but the frequency of all effects is increased.

Parts.Content: Deploys a [[Trailblazer]].

Parts.Name: Tech Extrapolator
Parts.Content:
The Tech Extrapolator is an item associated with the [[United Federation of Derelicts]], used by [[Scientist|Scientists]] to develop new parts. While attached, it can produce part schematics based on items that are seen on the ground or attached to other bots. Parts must be identified by Cogmind, but once they have been seen they can not be forgotten by the Tech Extrapolator, even if Cogmind forgets due to corruption or use of a [[Core Reset Matrix]]. A list of Tech Extrapolator only parts can be found at [[Tech Extrapolator Parts]].

[[Heading]]Obtaining[[/Heading]]
The Tech Extrapolator can be obtained by one of two methods:
[[List]][[SUBCON Basin]] delivery: A filled SUBCON Basin may be delivered from [[Subcaves]] to the Scraplab in [[Recycling]]. A Scientist will reward Cogmind with an Extrapolator.|Killing [[Scraptown]]: Tech Extrapolators are dropped from Scientists in Scraptown. Note: Tech Extrapolators dropped from Scientists in the Scraplab in Recycling will self-destruct.[[/List]]
